We also saw a table that had a big rectangular container with a boiling whole fish with Szechuan spices and peppers. We'll have to order that next time!

Extra points for having brown rice.

Service was fine. Having bottles of water at the tables was a nice touch. We were seated promptly and they gave us time to look at the menu before taking our order. The food came out pretty quickly, everything at once. We did have to flag down the staff to get our bill, but they were responsive.

10% off for Yelp check-ins! (for orders of $30+)
author: David A.

description:
we came here for new year's eve and it wasn't busy at all - PERFECT.  we ordered - dumplings in spicy chili oil, stir fried string beans, and whole fish (super spicy). and also a bucket of sapporo, cuz you know, it was new year's eve. so everything was super duper delicious and i think i would definitely come back, butttt we both got reallly sick the next day - i think maybe cuz of the fish..? so that kinda dampened the experience..

the service is good and servers are super friendly, so we'll see what happens next time!
author: Christina L.

description: We are visiting San Francisco and brought my entire family here. My wife and I lived in China for a year. This is by far and away the best Chinese food we have had since leaving china over 5 years ago. It was authentic and delicious. Keep in mind this is Sichuan Chinese food (spicy!) couldn't of been any better. Service was great as well. If you are looking for an authentic experience, this is your place. This is not PF Changs.
author: Phillip P.

description: I Love the spicy whole fishI've been eating here for several times. The food is simply amazing!!!!I would definitely come back!!!!
author: eva h.

description:
Super chill place to get awesome chinese food. We were staying a (straight up the hill) block away and were starving so this seemed like a good option. 

We ordered: 
--sesame chicken: delicious! crispy and very flavorful with the syrupy sauce that wasn't so overwhelming that you couldn't taste the chicken. I wish I could eat this all the time.
--won ton soup: HUGE bowl of perfectly seasoned broth, won tons, shrimp, and veggies. It was way, way too much for just one person so we split it and took some home.
--pork cubes (forgot the real name): this was all the boyfriend's doing since I couldn't get over the fatty parts. He said that they melted in his mouth and were incredibly rich (in the best way). Also came with broccoli.

Seasoned peanuts were also given for free. Yum!
author: April C.

description:
First, this resturant is cheating on TIPS. 

Based on their terrible food, i gave 8 dollars as tips of my $70 dinner. And because of their super bad food and super bad service, i thougt i was toooo generous on TIPS. 

However, when i checked my bank account that day, the tips become a lttile bit over $10. I was so angry with their cheating behavior and called my Chase BANK. They told me since it was still pending, i can do nothing.

Today, it is finally charged, however, the tips was charged over $12 dollars. 

I cant believe this!!!!!

Why there is a racism of Chinese in USA?! Just because these super shamless people!!!

What are u thinking? To try to steal money from your own people?! Can u do something that at least be meaningful？

The worst ever resturant!

Bad food, terrible service, cheating behavior. Shame of you as a Chinese！！！！

If you want to earn more money, please earn by your hard working, not cheating！！

------

A fish like this charged us $40 without notifying us. Now i understand why there is no one here in Friday night. the worst Chinese resturant ever in the bay area. Please try other place if u dont want to be fooled.
author: Siyu L.

description:
I ordered online at 7:15 PM on a Monday evening. Immediately after ordering, I called to ask how long it would take, and they said 50 minutes to an hour. I called at 8:15, and he said it would be another 15 minutes. It didn't arrive until 8:45 PM.

The food was mediocre. I got the Beef Broccoli, which was really bland. Not horrible, but not particularly good either.

TL;DR: Horrible delivery service, mediocre food.
author: Ben G.

description: I try the boiled fish was so good last night. That's good potion for dinner, and the drink was so tasty, I will come back for the Szechuan cuisine!
author: Huixin C.

description:
Ordered for delivery from Eat24 after reading the reviews here, and was not disappointed. If anything, Little Szechuan exceeded expectations.

Food arrived well within the promised time, immaculately packaged, each dish with its own printed label. Spiciness was what we anticipated based on the levels requested when ordering (medium to spicy but not very spicy).

It's a real joy to have options beyond the usual chow mein/moo shoo/hot and sour soup lineup. We tried (and liked) the sliced pork with spicy garlic sauce, fish filet with silky tofu, pork intestine boiled with flaming chili oil, Mongolian lamb, tan tan noodles, and seafood with tofu soup (ok, the last was fairly typical).

The point is, everything was tasty and perfectly cooked. You really can't ask for much more from takeout/delivery. We will certainly be ordering from Little Szechuan again.
author: Denny A.

description:
Decided to try them for their lunch specials.

I ordered Shanghai Soup Dumplings (I am obsessed with them in general and if a restaurant has it on their menu, I NEED to try it), this wasn't the best I've had... The meat was rather bland and the wonton was thick. I wouldn't eat this again. But the presentation and price were reasonable!

For the lunch special, I thought the price was amazing. You get tons of food; an entree and a dish for $8-12!
author: Amy H.

description:
Excellent Chinese cuisine that blows away anything in Financial District and North Beach (possibly even Chinatown for certain dishes). This place is relatively new and feels very clean and modern. There isn't much of a wait yet so it's pretty fast service. 

Most dishes on the menu are spicy so if that isn't your type of thing, this place isn't for you. The cumin lamb dish is excellent. The braised chicken with jalapeños (J2) is also really good and authentic. The mapo tofu is good. The spring pea shoots is the best vegetables (and it isn't spicey). If you're adventurous, B1 (Spicy Chili Combination of Beef & Intestine) is authentic and solid. 

This place has a corkage fee but it's a great place to bring a nice bottle of white to cut the spice down. Overall, I say this place is affordable, clean, and tasty -- most Chinese places in SF can't claim all 3. I think it's better than even Z&Y.
author: Victor W.

description: This might be one of the best Chinese food I've had. Went with a group of 4 and we all tried something different. All the plates were pretty Damn good.
author: Dariel S.

description:
I love it!
I used to order at home, very decent food!
Really good value/price ratio!
Finally at some point I visited the restaurant. 
The service was too polite for my taste (asking every 5 minutes if everything is OK) but I can live with that... the atmosphere was much better than the usual ethnic-asian style. 
The food is really delightful and the price, for SF is really good!
author: Antony T.

description:
Food was ok, nothing special.
What ticked me the wrong way is that the staff make a mistake in calculating the bill, keeping an item on the bill that was canceled since they had ran out, and then when I  mentioned it after they had already swiped my card, the cashier was unhappy and tried to blame me for making life difficult for her.
author: Stacy D.

description:
One of my office's regular lunch spots in rotation. Their lunch deals are very competitive and the portions are just right. 

Each lunch deal is about 6-9 dollars and come with hot and sour soup. You can also add a drink for just $1.

The restaurant and presentation of the food is clean. Their crab rangoons and dumplings are delicious too! They say they make their xiao long bao fresh themselves but I wasn't really a fan.

The servers are nice and smile when they see us walk in (again.) They have ample seating and also a party room downstairs I think.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
I was very impressed by the service, far exceeding the average level of Chinese restaurants. The ambiance is excellent too. 
As for food, they gave us very huge portions. 
Try their 烤鱼, which is like a grilled fish (with veggies) hot pot thing. The fish was gianttttt but we fished it cuz it was just very delicious. 
I was impressed by their spicy crispy chicken 辣子鸡 as well! The chicken was tender and well marinated, kinda reminded me of popcorn chicken. 
Definitely recommended! 

and dont forget to check in! You will get 15% off. Also check in on facebook to get a free milk tea. 

And thanks again for giving us such a huge fish lol that's why I promised the waitress to write a review on yelp
author: Judy J.

description:
Q: What do you get when you walk in to Little Schezuan drunk as a skunk with your hungry friends?
A: The most welcoming, friendliest, and warmest service, served with LOTS OF PATIENCE.


Geez, these people were the nicest people we met all day, especially after our abrupt exit from Vesuvio Cafe down the block after their bartender decided to put on his Ass Hat once we walked in.

We ordered 2 sakes (one of which we spilled all over the table and floor), fried noodles, more fried noodles, and fried rice. 

Wow, just wow. Great food, great drinks, huggable servers. We came back the next day.
author: Abraham L.

description:
The chinese food was mediocre. I got the sweet and sour chicken (soggy) , sesame chicken (crispy) and broccoli beef.

I wasn't too impressed. Definitely better chinese food in SF.
author: Brandon S.

description: Ordered from uber eats and my orange chicken did not come with rice. Just wow. Please make it clear next time, especially on a delivery menu!! Because now I can't eat my orange chicken!!
author: Holly M.

description: Terrible. The chicken curry, despite being recommended by our server, was bland but edible compared to the crappy shrimp dish. Our server was rude and refused to take anything off the bill, write us not finishing anything and pointing out there for quality of food the day after Thanksgiving. Avoid this place at all costs, $60 down the drain for us and it includes a b******* 18% service charge to be treated like s***
author: Sri P.

description:
I'd rate this place a 4, but the beef we ordered was unfortunately a total sham. The beef in Chili oil is $18.95 and not worth it. I'd highly recommend avoiding it because it's literally soup with some mushroom in it, and 3 slices of beef. 

As for the spicy chicken in the chef's sauce, that was top notch. Totally would order that again, along with the spicy pork. The spicy wontons were good too - will get that again.

As for the delivery, it came roughly on time (slightly late). She was courteous and wanted us to pick it up downstairs, but ended up delivering it to us upstairs, so thank you!

I'll order from them again, but will avoid that beef in Chili oil at all costs.
author: Albert K.

description:
One of my New Year's resolutions, write more Yelp! reviews.
So here goes my first one for 2014.
 
I love love love the decor of this place. It's modern, clean, and open. I also like when restaurants have an open kitchen so you can see the behind the scenes action.
 
We had the westlake beef soup, potstickers, chicken with red chilis, mongolian beef, and for dessert yummy sugar egg puffs (aka chinese donuts). Everything came out hot and tasted fresh. I also had to try the Hong Kong milk tea with tapioca which was delicious, not too sweet, and the little tapioca balls had just the right texture.
 
I have to say my favorites were the chicken with chilis, the mongolian beef,  and the sugar egg puffs (I have a bit of a sweet tooth). The chicken was hot, spicy, and crispy, and came in this cute little basket with lots of red chilis.
The mongolian beef was tender, flavorful, and spicy.
The sugar egg puffs came out hot and tasted like puffy balls of funnel cake with sugar sprinkled on top (sooo good).
 
I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Erin R.

description:
So when we visited SF we were dying for some chinese food. This place was near where we were staying. We decided to give it a try. We were greeted by friendly hellos by the staff. We had a lot of great yummy seafood dishes.The food was delicious and the service was great, especially the friendly owner Bobby. We definitely will be back next time we are in the bay area!! 
Definitely recommended!!
author: A. N.

description: The egg rolls and sesame chicken were good, but the cashew chicken and curry weren't prepared the way we expected. Good service.
author: Lee H.

description:
Spacious, nice and open.  They really need to work out the kinks.

Table is sticky, chair has crumbs, floor has used napkins...  Chopsticks are sticky, forks are dirty.  No water or hot tea.  

One waitress who is also cashier and making the boba drinks.

Potstickers - the outdid was warm but the inside was cold.  

Hot soy milk comes in mug, not a bowl as expected.  Not much flavor and not sweet enough.

Five spice beef roll - again, barely warm to cold at best.  Lots of hoisin sauce.

Spicy beef noodle soup - finally, something served hot as it should.  Good flavor but reminds me of instant noodle.  Beef were in huge pieces but was pretty tender.  Topped w/ green onion, cilantro and preserved mustard greens.   

There were only 2 other tables of 2 and a table of 10 with some take out orders. If they can't keep the place, tables, utensils clean and serve food hot - they are I some serious trouble.
author: Gloria H.

description: As a San Franciscan, I am PLEASED to find such a GEM! Honestly, I was skeptical when I sat down, but the food and the variety wooed me! Way to go! I will be back!
author: Aly M.

description: We ordered the bbq pork fried rice, Mongolian beef, sweet and sour pork and some salt and pepper calamari. Everything was great except the salt and pepper calamari, it was just too salty and could barely eat it. Delivery was pretty good as well and came on time.
author: Christine S.

description:
My name is Don, and I'm addicted to spices.

There, I said it. And this is why Little Szechuan is a dangerous zone for me - the last thing I want is fall off the wagon and end up 10 pounds heavier when I wake up the next day.

Little Szechuan is HOT when it comes to making spicy food. They've got a way of blending their spices to achieve that perfect kick. I had a friend who once claimed that this place was better than Z&Y, and I am inclined to agree.
author: Don L.

description:
I had the tan tan noodles and Kung pao prawn. Both were fantastic! I ordered them "medium spicy" and the packed the perfect amount of heat. I ordered them by delivery, and it arrived hot and fresh. I particularly loved Kung pao prawn  and sauce! 

All fantastic!! Thanks for the delicious taste of San Francisco!
author: Austin H.

description:
Very good Chinese but not the incredible experience was aiming for. We started with two apps, the green onion pancakes and the pot stickers.  Pancakes were great, wish we ordered more. Pot stickers very good but like you would have at any chinese restaurant. 

Best entree was chicken fried rice. Very tasty. Chicken satay on a sizzling plate most disappointing. Was supposed to be spicy and I picked the restaurant because my friend wanted spicy. Not at all spicy and did not have a satay flavor. We also had coffee rubbed ribs. I really liked them even though they did not have a coffee flavor, my friend thought they were too fried and fatty.  

Overall a good meal but not that unique or spicy.
author: Lloyd M.

description: This restaurant doesn't serve authentic sichuan food and is extremely expensive for the quality of the food. It is barely average and when we had eaten some of our food and it wasn't very good so I asked them to make the food spicier and the cook just dumped the food back into the pan that they were using to cook everything. Extremely unsanitary, and there was basically no one eating there we should've noticed right away that it wasn't worth it.
author: Wren X.

description:
It was our first time in china town and we were looking for some authentic chinese food. So we looked around and his place had some great reviews so we went in. There was no wait and everyone was extremely friendly. We sat down and proceeded to order beers and our waitress mentioned a special for a bucket so we said why not.

While looking over the menu a gentlemen who i would either guess the owner or manager introduced himself and broken english and asked if we had any questions. Each of us took turns asking which were his favorite dishes and he was friendly and helpful. 

My meal was amazing which was some dried spiced rubbed ribs that were delicious. Not too spicy but a good kick. We ate everything on our plates and were extremel6 satisfied.

Dont miss this place amazing.
author: Charly F.

description:
As a Chinese from mainland China, I recommend u keep ur feet far away from this restaurant. I will rate this restaurant -1 star if possible. I have no idea how the hell this one gains a four star on Yelp. We went to this restaurant in New Year's Eve and ordered couple dishes. I am not going to judge their food based on the taste, but rather on freshness, for one simple reason, u will never get Szechuan style dish right if u have never been lived in the area, or came from the area. Not enough spicy not enough spicy and freaking bland. 

Freshness. Couple of our dishes have tofu inside it. Based on the taste. I believed that they freezes their tofu, and de-freeze couple days ago before even considering serving. That's the only way u could change the texture of tofu into that kind of shit. Don't tell me that s hard tofu. They can freaking lie to white ppl about Asian food, but they can never fool a Chinese. Their tofu is 100% expired. 

Chicken. Never fresh. They must have pre-cook them and keep them day long. Meat is not fresh at all. 

This restaurant barely serve any fresh food to their customers. If u don't believe me? Feel free to try and prep-Ing for the worst experience.

18% service charge? For a waitress who could only bring dishes to the table and clean them our? For a waitress who could not understanding or remember what they have bees told besides ordering food, even if we talked to her in Chinese? God ur service is so freaking expensive.

At the end, what I wanna say is, if u really like Szechuan food, if u really considering ur own healthiness, stay away from this restaurant. Treat yourself better. I will not even serve this kind of food to my enemy, so freaking disrespectful.
author: Junqiao L.

description: avoid this catastrophe. Americanized. Might as well eat at Kung fu panda. This is the worst restaurant I've ever been to in my life, this place is a catastrophe a collision of salt and grime served right to you for exorbitant prices, avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid. Nobody here has been to Szechuan much less is native. Avoid!
author: Turkey B.

description: This place is nice they got friendly staff plus I came here with my mom and we were seated right away! We ordered the spicy chicken and spicy beef noodle! Let me tell you something!!! You must get the spicy beef noodle soup because it's so bomb!!! If you can't eat that much spicy food like me you can tell your waiter to make the food less spicy! I'm pretty satisfied and I will definitely come back for more! Yum!
author: Tina C.

description: Great service, food was spicy and good! The chicken wings are my fave. Parking is just a little tough.
author: Theresa M.

description:
I normally don't bother writing any reviews because it is easily perceived as fake, but for the first time I appreciate the review button, because it gives me an opportunities to shower my appreciation. 

Couple days ago I travelled to Chinatown in San Francisco. I revisited this place where has always been my favorite while I was living there. All the good memories came back with the great food, it was such a delight. When I was leaving, my uber driver called me so I left in a hurry. As a result, I left my $$150 earphone on the table. I didn't realize that 36 hours later, right before I was about to say good bye to my AirBnb host.

When I was about to give up, I thought about the restaurant and gave them a ring. The guy who was picking up the phone sounded so happy, as soon I said the word earphone, he shouted "Yes! The color is black!" Obviously they were waiting for me to call them back. He said he can't do anything unless I go and grab it. It was Sunday, 2 hours before I depart from my trip back to Honolulu. Then he forwarded me to a lady named Nikki, and she helped me to mail my earphone. Two days later, my earphone was there sitting right in my mail box with a FedEx envelop. (Of course I paid for it later)

Well, it's hard to find something so neatly thought out in this fast moving world. And I want to give my deepest appreciation to the people who were honest and sincere. I would definitely recommend this place to any other friend, the food is great, and you can eat at a place where you can trust. 

Food are all good here. Mapo toufu Mongolian beef was by order, if you want to extra spicy go for it. The chef is awesome. 

Again, thank you Nikki!
author: Dylan Z.

description: I come here with big group, Best chinese food from Chinatown.To start, we had seafood tofu soup.   we had dongpo pork, the meat was tender, which almost melts in your mouth. We also got cumin lamb, I love it! Everything is good! Serves is ok, they busy can't take are everybody!  No big deal for me! For sure comeback :)
author: Qinaid P.

description:
This is a new place. I came with my entire family - we have been to china . The actual country of china yes, and have visited Chinatown in Chicago New York and Toronto as well before coming to SF. 

Don't be fooled. This restaurant is legit. The food is very good. The meat is tender, and delicious, not chewy. We ordered beef chow fun , king pao chicken, sweet and sour chicken and Mongolian beef. Also the pork fried ice with added shrimp and the potstickers . Everything was amazing. It didn't all taste the same - had unique taste to it all. Everything was fresh and hot. 

Service was also very good. I think the actual owner came up to our table greeted us and we talked for a bit. 

Don't miss out on this place. It is bomb!!!!!
author: Arthur G.

description:
Ordered through Eat24.  Food was delivered pretty quickly but the experience went down hill from there.  One of the items I ordered was the szechuan beef.  This dish was like eating something that had been dropped on the ground at the beach.  There was something gritty and very unpleasant in it that was like eating sand.  I also ordered this mild and it arrived with 15 red peppers in a single portion.  I wanted some heat but definitely not that much!!  Reading other reviews it sounds like this place tends to overly spice just about everything.

One of the other dishes that I ordered was fish filet with mixed vegetables.  This was in the seafood section of their menu.  To me this sounds like a plated type of dish.  However, this is a noodle soup.  Not at all what I was expecting.   The form of the dish was not the only unexpected thing about it.  They also decided to include a nice long black hair in the soup and my partner unfortunately found it when he was eating a spoonful.

The restaurant really needs to put descriptions of their food on the menu, at least at Eat24.  Almost nothing has a description.

Very unlikely to order from here in the future.  Was very disappointed.
author: Rick V.

description:
I am here and the temperature must be about 50 degrees F inside. I have my flannel and my winter coat and it is barely enough. The biggest problem with this is that they bring your food out on cold plates and the hot food is cold 1 minute later. Where is the heat?

I cant judge the food not my expertise. 3 stars for freezing my ass off.
author: Curt M.

description:
Ok here we go... Used to love this place. Told all my friends about it. And now I will tell my friends all about it, but to NOT order from here, EVER!

Ordered online, delivery guy shows up, tells me he needs my credit card again to run it again. I ask why? I mean I paid for it, otherwise you wouldn't have gotten my order... I don't want you to run it again now, and have me deal with the credit card later that you double charged me. As we are debating this, I look at the delivery paper he is holding and notice my credit card number in full on it! so wait... you have my credit card number, so you CAN charge it, AND you have your delivery guys walking around with the ENTIRE CREDIT CARD NUMBER on paper??!! Seriously?

I say screw it, go up and grab the card... by that time the food is cold. Ok fine, I reheat it. I start eating it... FIND A DARK BLACK HAIR!! Seriously guys?? Really?

Summary: Don't trust them with your credit card, watch out for hair in your food! 

The owner was a jerk when I spoke with her on the phone, and when I told her I was going to write a review about my experience said "I don't care". Well... you got your review, hopefully customers will read and run the other way. Have a great day, and good night!
author: Ilya Movshovich M.

description: Not only was the food yummy and the atmosphere nice & warm, the wait staff was great as well. LET ME TELL YOU: my friend forgot her wallet under the table (it had slipped out of her purse). 2 hours after leaving the restaurant, she noticed it was gone and remembered the last place she had it. We called them, they said they had it - and they did. NOTHING was missing from it: she had plenty of cash & cards inside that could've been taken with no accountability. But no, they had it waiting for her.
author: Lacey R.

description:
I read the negative reviews before ordering, but when you've traveled all day, thousands of miles away from home, not feeling well, and very hungry, the 4 star yelp rating trumps all the negative reviews...

I didn't feel like leaving the hotel due to not feeling well.  So I placed an online order asking very specifically for a hot beverage, dried bean curd, and a few other items.  All the items were fine, but my "hot beverage" came iced and my dried bean curd was instead soft tofu in soup.  

Worst was when the delivery guy insisted he swipe my card, when in my opinion, they've already received my payment information through their online portal.  I called the owner on the phone and told them they have all of my information and they should be able to process the payment.  The owner said, "your card information is in the computer.  But we need your card to make the payment."  Doesn't make any sense to me, so I shooed them off and told them they have all the information they need from me, and I refused to give them my card again.  

Won't order from here again.  

But I did feel bad for the delivery guy who was stuck in the middle between an archaic/stubborn boss, and a logical/stubborn customer.
author: Elesai K.

description:
Can you say food poisoning? It's Friday night and I feel like dying right now. Cannot even level the restroom.

I'm so upset that I ordered from here and will never do so again. Their chicken wings must have been expired or bad meat bc my stomach hurts so much.
author: Mia F.

description:
This restaurant is right on the edge of Chinatown and Little Italy, and it wasn't very busy on a Friday night... I wonder why. Anyway I walked in with another friend as we were craving for Szechuan food. I like the way their tables are set up, and the restaurant is very spacious. We ordered steamed xiao long bao (Shanghaiese steam dumplings), Dong Bo fatty pork, Szechuan style fish and the famous long green bean with minced pork. Although the dishes didn't taste as authentic as what I had in Szechuan, I would say it's really not bad for the US standard. My friend ordered a bottle of sake and I had a glass of red wine.. Together the bill come in almost $75... I found it a bit pricy for Chinese food in a not-so-fancy restaurant. 

Most of the stars went to the service / staff. They are all very friendly and attentive. Another stars went to their big menu offering. I was quite impressed by the range of Chinese dishes they actually offered within one restaurant.

Will definitely go back to Little Szechuan with a larger group so we could share more dishes.... the bill!
author: Shaz L.

description: Ordered spicy chicken, cold noodle and szechuan lamb delivery . It was blah. Not ordering again
author: Srikanth D.

description: We got there right as they opened on our last day in SF. Everyone was SO friendly! The good was delicious and the portions are huge! We will definitely be back if we're in the area! We got Szechuan chicken, sesame chicken, beef fried rice, pot stickers and it was all delicious!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Ok the most unfortunate thing about this restaurant is it's right in the midst of Broadway dirty bars LOL.Helllooo Penthouse!
We wanted Szechuan food but it was Chinese New Year weekend so everything in Chinatown was packed. This place was not packed so yay. It does look more like a bar than restaurant but yes it is a restaurant. The food was pretty good.
author: Vol T.

description:
We had a kind of weird experience here, but overall it was great. Went to Hunan Homes originally and were told a 40 minute-1 hour wait, so we ventured here. When we got here, we sat down ordered drinks, and then a massive bus came in and clogged the kitchen. We got our food very, very fast and it was pretty good but it came in a weird order (Rice and potstickers were some of the last things to come out). 

We got the Tan Tan Noodles, General Tao's chicken, the Szechuan Tofu skillet, orange beef, and potstickers. Noodles were amazing, as was the tofu. The beef was good but verrry sweet almost like candy. General Tso's was very good, and the potstickers and the rice were very tasty. 

But here's why it gets 4 stars. The manager personally came out and apologized sincerely for the kitchen's troubles with such large parties. He made sure that we were very well taken care of tonight and anytime we came in the future, and promised to give us a basically custom order next time we came in. The staff actually cared about their patrons, and that's one of the best features of a restaurant. They've been around for just over a year apparently, but I'm sure they'll be around next time were in Chinatown!
author: Conor C.

description: Been here a few times for to-go. Have tried some items on the menu; the most memorable ones I can certainly recall are the general tso chicken and the orange chicken dishes. The meat is super tender. It is lightly fried and glazed with the flavorful sauce. Very satisfying!!  Will come back to try other items.
author: Terry L.

description: Sorry but it's not worth it. The amount of food you get compared to what you pay is a joke. I travel across the country and though the food at this restaurant isn't bad, it's definitely not worth the price. Peking Duck (half)???? It should have said a few slices of meat and skin. most Chinese restaurants give enough food to feed an army and it taste amazing. Little Szechuan just lives up to its name in proportions.
author: Eric P.

description: Over charge for dungeness crab. Waitress told us 15.95 for crab. The check came back for 59.00 for one crab.
author: Ae H.

description:
Two thumbs up for an awesome delivery experience! Less than 30 min from order to delivery and the food was spectacular
Spice was right on the medium spice order of dry Spicy Spareribs and the General Tao's Chicken was perfectly savory. I will be keeping Little Szechuan on my short list for Chinese
author: Marc J.

description:
Minimalists: Meh.

Others: I thought I was going to get a really nice and spicy Sichuan meal like I've had in Seattle's international district or New York's (Flushing) Chinatown or as prepared by a Sichuan/Chengdu native I know (hot pot style) but it seemed very oil- and starch-heavy in the sauce and pretty weak when it came to spice level.

I ordered Sichuan spicy tofu (should've done mapo tofu) and Sichuan lamb. I was expecting chili powder, chili peppers and hua jiao peppercorns but ended up with weak red/green peppers and OK flavor. Overall, the experience was 3-stars but this is way way different than I expected, hence the two-star rating.

I had the choice of waiting at Z&Y or R&G but wanted to choose between this place, Hunan's Home Restaurant or Lai Hong Lounge. Bad choice! Next time, I'm doing either Hunan's or Lai Hong.
author: Steve L.

description: The hot and sour soup is so amazing, every time I order food they let me know it is going to be late then they show up early. The lettuce wraps are wonderful and the pot stickers are even better! I would definitely order from here again!
author: Karli S.

description:
3 HOURS AND 30 MINUTES.

3 HOURS... and 30 FREAKING MINUTES. 

For delivery.

Two miles away.

Things I could've done in 3 hours and 30 minutes:

* Catch a movie at my local AMC
* Run a full marathon
* Fly one way to the midwest USA
* Assemble a bed frame from IKEA 

Yeah, I'm a little pissed. I understand dinner time is a busy time for most restaurants, but you can't just forget about my order and then start preparing the food once I call for a status 1.5 hours later. Seriously?

But wait, they never actually started preparing it! I had to call Delivery.com thirty minutes later so they could FORCE the staff at Little Szechuan to prepare the food. Yes, force them to start the food prep even though I paid them $50 already.

After they did that, I was quoted another 30-40 minutes. 

I still haven't received my food. I give up.
author: Tik P.

description: Delivery was super fast and the food was great! Very reasonably priced for what you get!!! I recommend the kung pao chicken, string beans, and crab rangoons! Definitely will order from this place again.
author: Nicole M.

description:
My husband and I were in town and decided we wanted SPICY Chinese food. We went on Yelp and decided on Little Szechuan. 

The restaurant was clean and very clean. The menu is extensive so we decided to try quite a few dishes. We decided on the potstickers and the hot and sour soup to start. Both were very tasty. The hot and sour soup definitely had a kick to it. For our entrees we had the braised string beans, salt & pepper calamari and the braised crispy chicken with jalapeno. Everything was fantastic. Some were a tad salty but it tasted great with the white rice. I highly recommend this place if you are into spicy foods!
author: Nancy A.

description: Good spot for lunch up the street from my office. My first visit I had Yu Xiang Zhu Rou (fragrant shredded pork) and Si Chuan Liang Mian (chilled noodles Sichuan style). Food was solid and reasonable,  but I would add the pork was a little too sweet and the noodles needed a splash of vinegar and chili sauce (both on the table). Though the noodles weren't part of the lunch menu, their lunch combos come with rice, hot and sour soup, and a small salad. This also seems to be a pretty popular spot as a tour bus full of elderly Chinese unloaded into the restaurant while I was there and everybody seemed satisfied. I'll be back!
author: Scott L.

description: Very enjoyable!!!  We dang near cleaned our plates and platters.  It had a Chinese Restaurant/Sports Bar kind of feel to it.  My party was pleasantly pleased.
author: NoNeck H.

description: Visiting from out of town. Wife felt like Chinese food, found this on yelp. Excellent.  General tso chicken, vegetarian hot sour tofu soup, vegetarian dumplings, string beans.  Nice atmosphere, friendly staff.
author: Raj S.

description: First time I went, the time I get in the door I have a strong like back to my hometown restaurant feel very warm and welcome , I ordered twice cook pork and spicy whole fish and one vegetable, food comes out really quick and the service is so good too. And I get a chance to visit the kitchen they have the most nice kitchen environment,all the stuff are clean and tidy, you don't need to worry about to have unhealthy food in here. No doubt to have my healthy, delicious food in here every time I can to Chinatown!!!!!
author: Yi L.

description:
The food was fine, but each dish was close to $20 after tax & tip, which is quite a lot for standard chinese food.  I would recommend going down the block to some other places in chinatown.

We got the beef roll ($9), Fish Fillet Boiled with Flaming Chili Oil ($17), Braised Crispy Chicken with Red Chili Oil ($13).  The portions were sizeable enough with leftovers for another half meal.  The taste was fine but not super special.  In general, not worth the higher price tag relative to House of Nanking, Z&Y, and others in the area.
author: Phil D.

description:
Lol okay remember how in my last review I said I only get delivery? Well, now that I discovered there's this cute girl working the counter during lunch on weekdays, I only do pickup.

My visits here serve two purposes now: the food itself provides sustenance for my body, and my attempts to sheepishly make small talk with her serve as a useful reminder that I'll probably die alone.
author: Jay S.

description: I've only ordered delivery from this place. As a Chinese, I can say their food is decent, at least they have some dishes that are not the typical Americanized Chinese ones that I like. The reason that I decided to review it today is actually because of the service. The delivery driver mixed my order with someone else, so I got the wrong food. I called back the restaurant, and they said we can keep the wrong food so that we don't have to be starved, and they would make a new order. Not that I like what the other person ordered, but it's true that we can at least have something to eat. The 2nd order showed up really fast. Would definitely order again.
author: Jenny N.

description:
RIP OFF!!! RIP OFF!!! This is an absolute RIP OFF!!! Never order from them again!!!
I ordered takeout through DoorDash and for 22 dollars I got VERY LITTLE FOOD!!! I ordered a beef dish and they only gave me half of the amount I usually got from other Chinese restaurants. I also ordered 3 buns and the buns were T-I-N-Y!!!
author: Dash L.

description: It's the time of the year to be thankful...for Chinese restaurants that are open during Christmas eve. It was pretty packed around dinner time so luckily we made reservations ahead of time. Some of the hits for our group included the salt and pepper chicken wings, braised string beans, and pea sprouts w/ garlic. The other dishes we ordered were good (braised crispy pork, braised crispy shrimp) , but just lacked quantity or were just okay compared to other restaurants (soup dumplings and beef rolls). A solid 3.5 stars.
author: Jeff T.

description: This place really hits the spot. I love spicy ma po tofu, and this place is definitely one of the top 3 that I've had across the country! Everything is made to order. The homemade dumplings were extra doughy.  The service was the best I've had in a long time. Our server was friendly, and I overheard him recommending dishes and customizing orders for other tables. Our waiter and others checked on our table every few minutes. With such great food and service, you should stop by if you're in Chinatown!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Got here 15 mins before closing they took us in and gave us fast service.

The food was decent. I has chicken fried rice and general to chicken. Fried rice was delish especially since they actually made it spicy on request. Nice quick bite to grab!
author: Tanvi C.

description: Truthfully, I haven't had a lot of Chinese food. But this restaurant was amazing I had a little bit of everything. From the combo curry to the orange chicken. The vibe and atmosphere was fantastic and the owner was a very down to earth. Even when the restaurant was closing the owner sat down with us and spoke to us in a really friendly food. I highly recommend coming here and the next time I come to San Fran I'm definitely coming back.
author: Jay T.

description:
I like coming here because the food is great, the decor is fun and there's never a wait for a table. That's the thing, though, I wish more people would find out about this place! It deserves just as much business as Z&Y and I hope this happens for them. 

Keep it up guys!
author: Lisa A.

description: The food is pretty good! But the delivery service is worse! I live in 5 floor, took 4mins to go downstairs to pick up the food after someone call me, but he just like can not wait. He called me again and again to ask me pick it up faster.
author: Yingxue H.

description: Good little dive with reasonable prices. Food could have been better, and servers had an attitude about them. Liked the proximity to Telegraph Hill.
author: Rajeev O.

description:
Delivery guy called me and so I went down to get the food. He looked pissed as hell but worse thing was he just took my change and ran off!!!!!?????? I know I should tip you but I felt robbed rather than giving tips???? 

I don't whether this guy works for you but anyway I generally enjoyed the food. All the orders were right, had to eat them for breakfast too cause portions were bigger than expected (which is good). 

What really bothered me was that delivery man and somehow your food is not spicy enough although you guys put a lot of Chilli. 

But good
author: Siyuan L.

description:
Delivery guy threatened to leave because I took 5 minutes to come downstairs from the hotel. He called me twice while I was trying to make my way... 
Food itself was terrible. 


I ordered 
- Mixed Vegetable Egg Foo Young:
  blend and wet. worst egg foo yung I've ever had...:(

-Braised Crispy Chicken with Jalapeno (aka chicken with chilies): 
   also blend and chilies were 90% of the dish. (NO JALAPENO)

- Hong Kong Style Fried Rice:
  WTF is this dish? no flavor with so many ingredients...  

Please think one more time before you try this place. Panda carries better food.
author: Jinsol C.

description:
Ordered delivery from here last night because the ratings on yelp were so high.  Maybe it's better to eat at the restaurant, but the food delivered was terrible.

The good:  The steamed dumplings were great.  If the rest of the meal were of the same quality, it would be perfect. 

The bad: The crab rangoon was almost inedible.  It was like a soggy pancake with cream cheese in the middle.  It was probably the worst crab rangoon I've ever had.

Just mediocre: The mapo tofu had spice, but it just didn't taste that appetizing. 

Decent: The vegetable lo mien was average, but pretty solid compared to the rest.

Also the minimum on delivery is $30!  I feel like I just wasted my money.
author: Max P.

description: I visited this store after looking the comments in yelp. It is very high comment score. But after this noon, I know it is just american style food. The food losts the nature of sichuan food. And the food is pricy. The service is not good. In conclusion, I will never go this restaurant as a lover of Sichuan food.
author: Lizi X.

description: Came all the way down here from Fillmore based on the Yelp review and got the worst Chinese food I've ever had. It tasted like salt and MSG, yeah that's all. We asked the server to make it less salty but it was still salty (server was super friendly though). We barely ate the dishes that was remade and it's making my stomach aching from the time I walked out of the restaurant.... Will never go there again.
author: Youna C.

description: The food was good, but we had to call them three times and our delivery took two hours. I suspect they had to remake our order and send a second delivery person. I would not order from them again, nor would I recommend them for timely delivery service. AFTER I asked, they offered a 20% discount, but I haven't yet seen that reflected on my statement. And for that inconvenience, I think the meal should have been free or they should have given us extra food.
author: Lisa Carolina M.

description: Found a long hair in my noodles and they still charged me for it, even though I asked them to take them back. The food was soaked in soy sauce, and had no flavor.
author: Andrei D.

description:
It was the best of times, it was the worst of times. 

I will admit, this was my very first meal in San Francisco so I had very high expectations.  Little Szechuan was a Chinese restaurant tucked into the hustle and bustle of SF. I ordered the milk tea with bubbles for drink and the spicy beef noodle (per recommended by Yelp) for a meal.  The bubble tea was extremely subpar - watery and the bubbles had clumped together that it looked like the kraken was about to swim out of my drink. The spicy beef noodles were tasty - but nothing extraordinary. The noodles were rather on the thicker side, similar more to an udon. The broth was spicy and the meat was a bit tough. It was truly 'spicy beef noodles' - nothing more and nothing less.
author: Yuyu S.

description: Don't let the picture fool you. There wasn't a peanut to be found in my Kung Poa Chicken. Which is disappointing to say the least. That's really one of the main reasons why I order this dish. With the being said, the meal was pretty good otherwise. Very tasteful and a good proportion. Just make sure you're not looking for peanuts like the ones in the picture.
author: William C.

description: I haven't been to this restaurant for a long time, but the recent visit was good. We ordered two dishes. They came fast and tasted over my expectation. With such decent price in San Mateo area, I will definitely come more often from now on.
author: Natalie Z.

description:
I came with a friend on a Sunday night around 7pm. I've been to quite a few really good Sichuan restaurants and so this place just doesn't do it for me. 

Shanghai Steamed Dumplings (Xiaolongbao) $5.98 - The price isn't so bad for 6 dumplings, but if you were looking for good quality XLB... definitely skip these soup dumplings. Since they were served/cooked on a spoon, the skin sticks to the spoon and doesn't always cook properly at the bottom.

Cumin Beef $9.98 - This was pretty good. I usually go for the cumin lamb whenever I eat Sichuan food, but this definitely hit the spot. I think I would have preferred it a little bit spicier, but they definitely got the cumin and Sichuan pepper flavors right!

Spicy Twice Cooked Pork $9.98 - This wasn't really spicy at all, but overall still pretty good. I expected a little bit more crispiness around the edges, but didn't get that.

Fish Filet w/ Spicy Chef Sauce $14.98 - Skip this! The fried fish filet was a bit too soggy by the time that it reached our table and the sauce was too sweet. We should have went with the fish filet boiled w/ flaming chili oil.

Steamed Rice (Per Bowl) $1.28 - Tasted like rice! Yum!

The service was terrible. It took forever to get their attention to order our food, get more water, and even get the check! I wouldn't blame them if it was busy, but it was a pretty empty night.
author: Andy T.

description:
I hate to say it but "Clean" and "Authentic Chinese food" are usually mutually exclusive. Not here! The atmosphere is open and airy. The food is spicy but not to the point where you can't feel your mouth anymore. We have returned a few times now and have loved it every time! Excellent customer service and super friendly staff that speak both Chinese and English. I live in North Beach and this is definitely one of the local restaurants we frequent when we don't go to one of the hole-in-the-walls in Chinatown.

What we order:
-I crave their little bits of popcorn chicken with peppers. Oh so savory with a touch of spice! 
-We also get their fish fillets in chili broth (translated literally as water cooked fish)
-Ja jiang mien: Fresh noodles in a fermented soybean paste. Sounds strange, but i promise it's delish!
-We've also had their beef rolls, spicy wontons in chili oil, fish fillet and preserved veggie soup, spicy beef tendon cold dish, and clear bean noodles in soup

I think their food is comparable to Z&Y restaurant without the wait :) It's not centrally located in Chinatown but the food is tasty and WAY more authentic than House of Nanking, which I personally think is a tourist trap.
author: Kelly Anne C.

description:
Great authentic Szechuan food, my new favorite place for Chinese in the area -- highly recommended! We got the fish in chili oil (my favorite; full of flavor and almost melts in your mouth) and their signature chicken dish, which was impressively presented and loaded with chili peppers. It looks really spicy but is actually pretty manageable. 

You can easily walk in without a wait, and the space is much nicer than your typical hole in the wall Chinese restaurant.
author: Jia H.

description:
When I saw the overall ratings level and the comments that the food is better than Z&Y (or Chili House, which is Z&Y's sister restaurant in the RIchmond district), I knew I had to try it.

Overall, I have to say that Z&Y flavor is still far superior.  However, one significant thing in Little Szechuan's favor...they deliver!

So, we ordered the 

Chicken with jalapenios (Chongqing lazi jiding)
Pea sprouts with garlic 
Mapo Tofu
Red oil wontons
Cold cucumber


The chongqing lazi jiding were flavorful and good--the amount of chicken is definitely less than Z&Y (and I think the price is 1/3 less, too), and I found the batter a little thicker. Z&Y wins this one

Pea sprouts with garlic--great flavor, highly fresh, perfectly salted and cooked.  Excellent dish Tie with Z&Y

Mapo Tofu--spicy, but aside from that, pretty bland.  Didn't detect any use of sichuan peppercorn (no mala flavor), and tofu didn't have any flavor (i.e., didn't use enough or not enough salt).  Uninspired at bet.  Z&Y's way better

Red oil wontons--same issue as Mapo Tofu--has some red oil, but otherwise, the sauce didn't have garlic, nor any vinegar or sugar (at least not that I could detect).  To summarize, a bit bland. And the wonton skins were pretty thick.  Texture closer to dumplings than paper thin wontons.  Definitely Z&Y here

Cold cucumber...not sure if Z&Y has this dish (or I haven't ordered it).  I was expecting something extremely light (i.e., just garlic and cucumber), but it had some vinegar and chili oil with it.  Flavor was good, although a bit vinegary for me (note, I'm super sensitive to sour flavors)--my wife liked this dish fine.  

One major caveat--they did deliver to our hotel....however, I've also had Z&Y takeout, so I don't think that was a major factor in my evaluation.  

Let the debate continue!!
author: Howard T.

description: We liked their spicy chicken a lot. Vegetable dishes are good as well. They would have the word "vegetarian" if the dish doesn't have any kind of meat in it.
author: Bevvy H.

description: First day of my trip to San Francisco I found this restaurant on postmates. I got the Mongolian beef and my girlfriend ordered the orange chicken. The prices weren't bad considering how expensive everything is up here. When the food arrived I was pleasantly surprised to see a heap of Mongolian beef and a moderate portion of rice. Certainly well worth the price. It had a bite to it and I love spicy food. The orange chicken was good. I had to snag a bite from my girl of course. All in all certainly a place I would recommend to anyone passing through the area. Certainly better than anything I've had in a long while.
author: Adam W.

description: today I come here in lunch again after few weeks. Dong Po Meat is very good. The meat is soft. When I put in the mouth, it can be in my stomach. I love it! I also order hot and sour soup. It is vegetarian. The taste is not bad. You have to try if you go. Keeping the best standard with chief！！
author: Fay M.

description:
This is for an EAT24 review. 

The food was delivered an hour and a half after being ordered,after we were given a 20-40 minute delivery window. The food was cold, dry but also terrible. I ordered the cucumber salad, awful. The fried rice and Mongolian beef lacked flavor. Not worth the price!
author: Lexi B.

description:
Came here for lunch and was pretty pleased.  They have a pretty nice selection of items on their lunch special menu.  Everything was  less than $10 which was nice.  You get free soup as well.  You can add an ice tea for $1.  They have flavor ones as well.  I'm pretty sure I'll be back.  

The place is clean and has spacious.  Their ventilation system seems pretty good as well because the restaurant doesn't smell too strong.  Don't get me wrong, I love the smell of food, but I don't always want to smell like it, especially  for the rest of the day.
author: Steven H.

description: I decided to try this place for hot pot and I strongly discourage anyone to go here for hot pot. First of all the soup bases was 15.99. We got one spicy and one not spicy, total about 32 just for the soup base, which is ridiculous since other places offered it for free. The hot pot is not unlimited and you have to pay per serving. The meat slices are thick and frozen, does not feel fresh. What is more ridiculous is that they charges us one dollar for each of the sauce we got for the hot pot! Seriously! Finally, the service was not good, we went in around 4pm which is not very busy time but our service was slow and if we didn't try continuously to get our servers attention, they probably would forget us. Overall experience was disappointing. Will not go back.
author: Melody W.

description: Fried the whole fish cost me 50$$$$$, tooooooo EXPENSIVE!!!!!! The price did not show up in the menu, or we would never order. Otherwise, the service was good.
author: Cynthia X.

description:
I've gotta say - I'm not loving this place at all. I'm pretty surprised it's rated as highly as it is. 

My husband and I had been meaning to try Little Szechuan since it opened early last year.  We ordered:

Chicken Chow Mein : Pretty OK
Shanghai Dumplings: Terrible - SUPER sour and chewy. Tasted like they might be microwaved.
Moo Shu Pork : Less than average, stunk horribly, and the hoison sauce comes in two little plastic packets (like ketchup). 

If you're looking for better Chinese takeout in the neighborhood try Brandy Ho's or Z&Y.
author: e v.

description:
Just mediocre. We got delivery, and though it wasn't awful, we wouldn't order from here again. Broccoli beef was overly sweet. Chow mien had a funny taste. Kung poa prawns and wor own ton soup were okay. The food all tastes like it was cooked from being frozen. 

Also, we only live a few blocks away from the restaurant, but our food was barely warm when it arrived.
author: Jessi M.

description:
WOW! The food was great here, and the service was excellent as well. My wife is Taiwanese, so her Mandarin might have gotten us some bonus points, but she's very picky about Chinese food, and she liked everything that we had. The owner was very helpful in suggesting dishes to try, and he was VERY accommodating because we had a few people that didn't like spicy food. (You may ask, why did they go to "Little Szechuan" then? It's a long story.) You can't really make true Szechuan dishes and have them be "not spicy", but the chef did a great job of it and everyone loved their dinner.

The restaurant was huge and nearly empty when we were there, but don't let that fool you. I think we may have been there at an off time, because a place this good should be packing them in!
author: Allan M.

description: This is a very good Chinese restaurant, the service, the dishes are impressive, as a tour guide, all my guests from China here they can feel tastes of home, so, want to taste the middle of sichuan cuisine, I recommend the little sichuan.
author: Martin L.

description:
I walked in with my boyfriend on Labor Day.  We were ignored the entire time.  We waited at the entrance and decided to leave. 
Once we left, the waiter turned to look at us. I guess he didn't care to have us as guests. All the flies in the restaurant didn't help.
I would not go back. Horrible customer service as far as Im concerned.
author: Irma P.

description:
Tried this place for lunch with a group of my co-workers on NYE 2014. We came here because we had a large group (8), some of the group had been there before, it was walking distance from our office in north beach, food was solid and the price was right. We were especially interested in the complimentary sweet and sour soup served for that super cold day!

The place was almost empty when we came, makes sense on NYE at lunch time. For the table we ordered eggplant, shrimp chow mein, a seafood hot pot, crispy chicken (the one with a mountain of peppers), green sprouts (i think?), pork dumplings and veggie dumplings. 

We all ate to our satisfaction. The portions were right on. Service was quick and friendly. 

From what I tried: the veggie dumplings were really good, not out of the ordinary so not much to say, I would definitely order them again. The eggplant was reallyyy good! Greasier than I would've liked (but duh, its chinese), but super flavorful and cool looking. The seafood hot pot was not to my liking at all, it was extremely over salted, not sure if that's just how it is supposed to be. Chow mein also solid. Free sweet and sour soup was also yummy. 

Overall, solid chinese spot with a  lot of menu items, ideal for a group that doesn't want to spend a fortune.
author: Zahra K.

description: I took my picky friend here for a casual lunch and it was delicious. We ordered the General Chicken and Chicken Chow Mein. Very tasty and fresh, and the prices were very reasonable. Ambiance was spacious, pretty dark, and quiet enough where we could talk easily. Best of all, it was far enough away from FiDi to not get too crowded during lunchtime, even without reservations. I'll be back!
author: Irina D.

description:
EXCELLENT FOOD! Since it's not in the heart of Chinatown, it was far less crowded than z&y restuarant (i.e. no wait vs. 2 hours). The string beans and mabo tofu were delicious, spicy and flavorful. I was slightly disappointed in the lamb in that it was very overtaken by the sauces; you couldn't really tell if you were eating lamb or beef. But otherwise, I will gladly return! I always have hankerings for sichuan food and they did not disappoint.

EDIT: I've knocked it down a star as my friend, who doesn't eat beef and gets sick when he does, confirmed that the 'lamb' we ordered was most likely beef because he got sick after the meal.
author: Ryan D.

description:
I have been coming to little Szechuan since February and I have to say the food is consistently delicious and reasonably priced. The restaurant is clean and the service is attentive.

My favorite dishes include
*crispy chicken with Jalapeño  
*twice cooked pork (we substitute w beef)
*salt and pepper fish filet
*pea sprouts with garlic
*beef chow fun (I substitute with chicken)

They also do delivery within 1 mile I think.

I hope more people come and try this place because you don't know what you are missing out on!
author: s l.

description:
I fear this place will shut before long -- which would be a tragedy. Try it quick! 
This restaurant dishes out cuisine that more closely approaches authenticity than many other so-called Sichuanese eateries in Northern California (though to be honest, that's not saying much) at a bargain price, despite being nestled in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Check in on Facebook and get a free drink. Recommendations: the water-boiled beef and fish (shuizu niu/yu rou) and the excellent dandan noodles. I just hope their business picks up or, like so many other businesses on the strip of Broadway near the bay, it'll fall by the wayside.
author: Edwin C.

description:
Place was not crowded for lunch....not sure why it was so slow.  The place was roomy and clean though, still had that new restaurant smell.

Service slow...they forgot our drinks.  Had to ask for it.  They did apologize for the delay.

Food wise...I really had better...sad to say he chicken wing appetizer was the best thing we ordered.  Crispy, sweet, yummy....must order!

I ordered the Sesame chicken lunch special...dry, with a bitter after taste...not sure where the bitterness came from.  Could have been the sauce, which appeared a bit dark.  The lunch special does come with hot and sour soup.

For an extra $1 with the purchase of the lunch special, you get a drink, I ordered ice coffee.  Lets say, the coffee tasted like sweet colored water.  I really could  not tell if it was coffee or another water based drink.

I did not have the opportunity to check out the bathroom.  Not sure if I want to come back to this place again....there are other places a few blocks up Broadway.
author: Jerry W.

description:
Mahn this place is Awesome. 
Who eva comes to this place should surely try 1) Sesame Chicken and 2) singapore fried noodles.
author: Atanu S.

description:
First impression: the place has a nice interior and the staff is attentive

Order: Mapo Tofu and Twice Cooked Pork

The Mapo Tofu did not have the characteristic bright red oil and was pretty underwhelming. Although they had the fermented black beans, the sauce was just not on point. 

The Twice Cooked Pork was decently seasoned but the strips of pork belly were not as thick as what I'm used to and there was a low pork to green bell pepper ratio.

All in all, the service was solid but the food is just not there.
author: Graham P.

description:
Favorite spicy Chinese place in the city.

Staff is friendly and quick. Food should be more spicier but spicy enough for most. I like the:
- Pork in hot oil & Beef in Hot oil
- Twice cooked pork. 
- Mapo tofu, you can ask for very spicy
- Braised string beans is awesome
author: Omar S.

description: Food was great, and the service was HORRIBLE! Upon being seated at a not-so-busy time, we waited a few minutes to be served. One server got drink orders, and after waiting another ten to fifteen minutes, we finally had our food orders taken by a different server. The food took another 25 - 30 minutes to get to us, but only three out of the five of us were served. After inquiring, the other two got served after another 10 minutes. The only other time we had service was when we received our checks. Terrible service.
author: Chuck M.

description:
So this place is on Eat 24, I ordered from here and here's what I remember thinking: 
1) That was so fast 
2) This is so delicious : five spices beef roll

I ordered a ton of food, 60 dollars worth for a friend and I, but I ate it over the next 2 days. 

I ordered:
Spicy wontons- very very good and reheat well. 
Five spices beef roll- so so delicious and I'm usually not a fried food fan
Chef special spicy whole fish-very good as well not able to be expressed in words.
In short: stick to the spicy wonton and five spices beef roll
author: Lohu K.

description: Wow the food here is amazing!!! My husband was not feeling Chinese but I was! I dragged him here and he absolutely loved it! We had the braised string beans, chicken with jalapeños, and the sweet and sour soup! By far the best soup I have ever had! We are from Los Angeles and we will definitely come back here!!
author: Annette G.

description:
The chile Saudi here is the best I've tasted! 
 Came for lunch and ordered what I usually order when I try a new Chinese place. Sweet and sour pork. To me, if you can't get this basic dish right, then the rest of the menu probably isn't that good. I also ordered a order of potstickers. 
 Hot and sour soup was served first. I actually enjoyed this. It wasn't the typical hit and sour shoved in front of you because it's cheap, this actually had flavor and it has a nice kick to it. Very surprising. 
 Next came the sweet and sour pork. Came with steamed rice and was a good portion. Tasted good. The pot stickers were served at the say time. 
 The pot stickers were good. Fried perfectly, and a good ginger mix. 
 I like my potstickers with vinegar and soy with some chile Sauce on top. Now is where this place shines! Their chile sauce, not the typical sitting on the table fermenting for the last 10 years. This is GOOD! Different and the best I've had. They make it fresh and add garlic to it. I've never had chili sauce like this before! Something so simple, and they stepped it up a million times. A must to try!
author: James T.

description:
I was in this restaurant 1 week ago with my friends, when I was in San Francisco and I must admit this is one of the best asian restaurants I have ever been in the city. From the outside , the place looks like a decent size building. But once I was in, I was surprised from its interior. The place has two floors and all tables  are organized in such a way that you don't  need to sit close with other customers. I also liked the stage where they were displaying different types of wines,too.

I ordered Cumin Lamb with steamed rice (Q11) and it was very delicious. The spice they are using made the taste of the meat so good. The rice was also tasty too, however it was a little bit too much compared to the size of meat.
I would recommend the restaurant manager to increase the portion of the meat in the menus more  and reduce the rice a little bit. 
The price I paid for my lunch was not so expensive compared to other places in San Francisco. I will definitely go to this place again as I want to try Mongolian Beef too.
author: Orcun P.

description:
This gotta be one of the best Szechuan restaurants within its 10 mile radius. I kid you not! 

I can pop that perfectly crisped boneless J2 Jalapeno Chicken ALLLLL DAY! The only thing stopping me would be my sore hand from holding the chopsticks too long. The cray cray red peppers that come with the dish might seem intimidating but noooooooooo that's cause you are not supposed to eat them. Leave the peppers out, you will get the same level of satisfaction. 

Not trying to sound like a white boy but that Saweet & Sour Chicken will blow your mind, FROM BEHIND! The chicken pieces are evenly crusted and beautifully coated with that sweet tangy red SAUce.They are so good they will turn a chicken hater into a chicken lover. They are so good you will feel like a caveman using a champagne gold iPhone 5S for the first time to call his wife who is busy gathering tree roots for their soup of the day. It blew his mind. 

The Cumin Lamb! Forget about spending $1700 flying to Mongolia. They will bring you Mongolia for a mere $8.98 and that comes with rice and soup. No Mongolian can cut you a deal like that I'm telling you. Take a bite, close your eyes, take a breath, you hear that? That's Mongolian folk music & horses galloping through the Mongolian lush green grassland. If that doesn't convince you, try the Mongolian Beef. Word. 

All crazy jokes aside, this place is 5 outta 5 solid. You gotta at least try it once in your lifetime if you are in the area. Put it on your bucket list next to seeing the Aurora Borealis or better your to-do list right after dry cleaning your dusty New York style winter jacket.
author: Twen T.

description:
Keep walking. I don't mind bad service if the food is on par, but this was a crash and burn that no one enjoys experiencing. My friend and I went here yesterday for dinner. I ordered the Triple Delight Dumplings and the Vegetarian Tofu Clay Pot/Sizzling Platter. The dumplings were not a delight- I could've done better buying some at the grocery. My entree arrived as the wrong order and they gave me the Mapo Tofu...my friend flagged down the waiter and got the issue corrected. When my entree finally arrived...well, let's just say I'm more than underwhelmed by the whole experience. I've had (a lot) better in Phoenix, AZ.
If you're looking for authentic Chinese food, keep looking elsewhere. This place is not it. They also charged extra for the rice and hot tea. This is not the norm at an authentic Chinese restaurant. Those items should be complimentary. Example would be in NYC Chinatown. Some might say "But that's NYC, we're West Coast!" Well it's also complimentary in Phoenix/Tempe/Chandler, AZ. And if AZ if stepping up better on the Chinese cuisine than NorCal, we have a problem people.
author: Dora L.

description: I ordered delivery from this place via Eat24. Eat24 said that delivery will be 75 minutes "confirmed". The food arrived after 95 minutes and they didn't bring one item. They should have called to ask about a substitution if the item wasn't available in order to make sure that there's enough food for the number of people that it was ordered for. The taste of the food was sub-par as well. Very disappointed.
author: A C.

description: Very good food, portions & atmosphere!   Got here right before the Super Bowl and will be back next time I'm in town.
author: Mel C.

description:
I've ordered take out a few times from here. General's chicken is good, very flavorful with just the right spice. I like there chicken products because it has meat and it's not all dough. My last order was the orange chicken and it was great. Fried rice was bland. Shrimp chow mien was good.

Good food, I will be a repeat customer.
author: Brandon O.

description: As a Chinese person who loves sichuan food and been religiously eating sichuan food for the past 10 years in China, I don't think this place is very authentic. Though they throw in a bunch of different peppers, the flavor is just not there. Out of the four dishes we ordered, i recommend sichuan cold noodles.
author: Tutukova J.

description: The gentlemen over the phone Bobby was very helpful and courteous. We ordered to our hotel and it came very quickly and was still hot. Food was yummy and fresh. Crab rangoons were delish.
author: Nikko A.

description: Yum! We were in need of a new lunch spot and Little Szechuan was recommended from a colleague. It's a decent walk from our work, but definitely worth it. It's conveniently located and has a pretty big space inside. When we went in, there was a group of 20+ set up, so this would be a great place to gather all of your friends! They have lunch specials (score!), lots of options to choose from and we got our food super quickly. $21 + tip for two people, two dishes, a diet coke and a beer. Not bad at all! We weren't fans of the soup you get before the meal, but no big deal! The food we ordered was delicious! We'll be back for sure!
author: Sheena C.

description: Was looking to try a different place for once in chinatown and found this one on Yelp.  The hot and sour soup came right out and it was delicious. The only complaint was that it was lukewarm. Would have like it hotter.  The pot stickers were good. For the main dish, I got the spicy chicken in chili oil. Was a great dish with an excellent presentation. I would have like it spicier since I'd rate the spice at 5 on a scale of 1-10. Service was friendly and the food came quick.
author: Mike T.

description:
On my stroll through Chinatown, I felt a sudden craving for Szechuan Food. After having gone through some reviews on Yelp, I decided to give this relatively new restaurant a shot.

Location: 5 stars
I was a glad to be in a non-sketchy Chinese restaurant: the tables were clean, the light was not too dim, and the furniture was quite stylish (if I may say so even though I am only a crude engineer). In my opinion, the only thing in a Chinese restaurant that has to be authentically Chinese is the food.

Service: 5 stars
Not much to say. The name of my waiter was Bobby, and he was as nice and attentive as it gets. I told him I was in a hurry, so it took only like 5 minutes or so to serve my food. Both thumbs up!

Food: 4.5 stars
First things first: Both my parents are Chinese, so I have had a fair share of Chinese food in my life. They are from the Hubei area, so we really appreciate spicy food. I ordered spicy fish in chili sauce (水煮鱼; E3 I think), which is one of my favorites. The fish was tender, and the chili sauce was delicious. I prefer to have more vegetables with the fish, but purists may have a different opinion on this. Therefore, "only" 4.5 stars for the food.

So all in all, it was a very pleasant experience. I would definitely go there again!
author: Hans Y.

description: meet up with a couple of friends here we order random stuffs and I can say the food here was tasty. I would return to try other items here but what was  most memorable time here was the sugar eggs puffs they were so delicious would return for some more to go please hehe
author: Linda B.

description:
We had lunch today, on a Sunday, and place was empty.  The food was very good. I'd say the only negative is the portions are pretty small for the for the price. $10 for their spicy green beans is pretty steep, for example.

The beans were very good.  We also had the beef roll (they use the onion pancake) and spicy fish in chile oil, some brown rice.

We walked to Stella Bakery afterwards for tiramisu.
author: Foodlover B.

description: Great costumer service! Give us free milk tea when we are leaving, and it tastes so good. Nice environment also, not as crowded as other restaurants.
author: Yiqing W.

description: This one is so bad. Tastes like eating MSG, not fresh, little portion, not clean neither. If you can find a worse one, I'll pay you.
author: Arthur Z.

description:
not authentic Chinese food but I don't mind eating it.
like the beef cube with tofu--meat is super soft
I also like the pumpkin cake.  it's nice to eat that for desert.
they also serve brown rice, which I love.
author: Rina C.

description: This place was terrific for late lunch. I entered with my boyfriend and we ordered a meat dish and the fried eggplant dish and the portion sizes were huge. They were also very friendly and welcoming. Definitely will recommend to anybody.
author: Sujee S.

description: First time ordering from this place. Mapo tofu, vegetable chow mein, kung pao chicken, braised string beans all tasty. Asked for very spicy but the dishes didn't take me to capsaicin heaven. But not too disappointed as the food was flavorful and fresh. Ordered delivery so don't know how the service and restaurant itself rate. But they delivered on time and with all asked for condiments.
author: L Y.

description: Super tasty chinese food!! The honey walnut prawns are to dieeee for and the braised string beans were amazing. The szechuan chicken was alright as well. Servers were super friendly and the place is pretty spacious inside. Would def come back.
author: Beatriz G.

description:
Ordered delivery from here a couple nights ago, and I think it all depends on what you order. Some hits, some misses, here are my ratings on a dish by dish rating: 

-Tan tan noodles -- 5 stars -- delicious, spicy, tasted very authentic, would definitely order here again for this dish
-Five spices beef rolls -- 4 stars -- not too greasy, good portion size
-Spicy dumplings -- 4 stars -- yummy, good spice, authentic
-Chicken fried rice -- 2 stars -- a little dry, needed more salt
-Eggplant w garlic sauce -- 1 star -- deep fried and then drenched in garlic sauce, I did not like it or expect the eggplant to be deep fried. if you're into that, maybe you'd like it.

Will add Little Szechuan to the rotation but still need to figure out what other dishes are good/authentic here.
author: Jessica W.

description: Very good food, could be super spicy but also mild if you can't handle the szechuan taste.
author: Mathieu F.

description: Love love love. I love the decoration and ambience of this restaurant. We ordered the spicy chicken braised and spicy dry prawn. The food is amazing if you like Szechuan or Chinese food. Did I mention about the restroom?? I felt like I was in those classy Chinese movies where rich people go to eat in expensive restaurants. Will definitely go here again.
author: Ellen N.

description:
Had a good experience here for dinner. Four stars because I found that the food was adequate but not dazzling. The service was really quite friendly. 

I'm a bit of a skeptic so I'll say it like this, our server, Bobby, made us feel like we were being treated well with little treats here and there (free refills on rice bowls and free tea). I'm not sure if they were actually treats, but he said they were. Someone should check for me. I felt great in the moment. A girl just wants to feel good, y'know?

I thought the food was a good mix of authentic and americanized. Got some cold Sichuan styled chicken that was tasty. Also had some shredded pork, bok choy with garlic and crispy, spicy garlic prawns. First two were pretty simple, and the prawns were a bit expensive and few in number (that's how it is, though). In hindsight, I would have liked everything to have been more spicy, but they did offer that avenue in the beginning, so I find only myself to blame.
Bobby told me he rated most of it as a 6 out of 10 in spiciness, so take that as you will. If you like a good kick, I would suggest asking for extra spicy.

Cheers, Bobby.
author: Robbie Z.

description: My go to Szechuan spot in SF. I was born in Szechuan and grew up on the food at home and relatives. Little Szechuan embodies the food revolution in SF, getting as close to authentic as I have tasted in the US (and outside of Flushing, NY). The twice cooked pork and pork/beef/fish in flaming hot oil are the go-to's. Green onion pancakes and beef tendons serve as great appetizers. They deliver as well, so add convenience. Will definitely keep going back as long as this continues.
author: Anthony D.

description:
This is for the food delivery service we ordered to our hotel room at the palace hotel. 

Guy on the phone was nice and patient . $30 minimum for delivery though. He said 45 min wait but seemed way faster than that or I was just buzzing off the wine and whiskey I've been having all day. 

Beef fried rice ! 
Think they use soy sauce in it since it was brown and saltier than normal but it wasnt oveely salty .I prefer it without the mix since the other dishes have a lot of flavor to them but overall the fried rice satisfied my hunger along with the honey walnut shrimp 

... can't go wrong with honey walnut shrimp ever! .. I hope. 
Not too much mayo. Just the right amount and not too sweet :) bomb.com ty. 

The seafood tofu soup quenched and warmed up my tummy. It was still very hot delivered :D yay. 
ALTHOUGH I will say that there was barely any seafood in there. Like .. couple or maybe even several white fish pieces?  
I'd suggest just getting some other soup. 
Because you are probably paying extra for the "seafood" part of the menu. 
BUT I'm not saying the soup was bad. It was still tasty. 

Also  I like how they label the togo boxes with neatly printed stickers telling which item is which. That's just a little extra I liked about this place. It's cute hah.
author: Jessie Y.

description: Used EAT24 and got my food within the hour! Good, clean Chinese Food. Ordered the MuShu Chicken, Spicy Green Beans, Pork Fried Rice. Nothing was greasy, no MSG! love love love!! Will definitely go back. Next day had no MSG or food hang over. It is far and above the best Chinese food I have ever eaten...and I eat a lot of Chinese food.
author: Rachel W.

description:
I like this restaurant, I like to eat spicy food. The service is very good. 
Dong po marinated pork is very delicious. It's sweet and sour. The taste is good. 
Tan Tan noodle is the one I like.
author: Emilie L.

description:
Wow, have I been missing out.
