Went tonight for the first time, had the dan dan mian, beef pancake and the garlic bean sprouts and everything was delicious (though a tad heavy on the oil). 

The dan dan mian was the most frangrantly numbing (a positive attribute) sauce I've ever tried and the beef pancake was an interesting blend of sweet and savory at the same time - sweeter than expected. 

Definitely recommend for bored tastebuds!
author: Leo J.

description: Visited last night and ordered food as take out.  Everything was delicious and fresh.  We decided on this place after seeing all the positive reviews here on Yelp, we were NOT disappointed.  Even after driving quite a bit before getting to our hotel to eat, everything was still warm and yummy!  I have to say that their orange chicken is probably the best I've had anywhere!
author: Susie D.

description:
Maybe because it was a group tour lunch, food was mediocre at best. Preordered meal by tour company.  Each course (plate)came lukewarm and not enough to divide by 10 persons at table.  Had to ask for tea.
I had looked forward to eating here but it's a pass now for me.


Since posting this review I need to let everyone know the owner has been in touch with me
and she hopes to do better the next time.
author: c l.

description:
Late night dinner - was glad to see they were open until 11pm, as it was pushing 930 before we were ready for dinner.
Hands down, the best Chinese food I have ever had. Period. We ordered so much food, the staff probably thought we (only two of us) were crazy. Everything was served hot, fresh and delicious. The service was excellent too. 
Potstickers, hot and sour soup, General's Chicken, Hunan beef, Schezuan beef - portions were huge, flavors very distinct between each dish.  The iced tea is excellent too. 
I have added this place to my contact list in my phone and will be the first place I visit when I return to the Bay area!!  Thank you to the owners and staff for such an awesome dining experience.
author: Alan N.

description:
This place is perfect.  The food is affordable, well-presented and consistently delicious.

I call in for take-out a lot but the place itself is attractive and clean.

:)  The sesame chicken and walnut prawns are the way to go!
author: Victor R.

description: Food was great, atmosphere great.  However after we got our food no one came to check on us.  Jasmine tea is not so great.
author: Ryan D.

description: I confess I'm not a big fan of Chinese food. The food at Little Szechuan was good but not great.
author: Shirin O.

description:
Awesome food, awesome service!

Closes later than some other places nearby.
author: Arjuna R.

description: Food is ok portion for the price. Not very authentic, a little Americanized. Didn't notice they add an 18% service charge for the 5 of us...
author: Rong Y.

description:
Based on Yelp reviews, I made dinner reservation for this restaurant. My experience was disappointment.  Here are the reasons, I list this experience (in order of disappointment) :

1) The food was below average . Couple of chicken dishes had more full red peppers then pieces of chicken. One has to fish for chicken pieces in bulk red peppers.
2) I ordered Soup and main dishes. They brought dishes to table first before serving the soup. I asked waitress to get dishes later but she didn't quite understand.  
3) The water bottle was kept on my table as soon as we arrived but I had to ask 4 times for glasses. This was in spite of the fact that restaurant didn't have much crowd. I can understand if they are full but with three tables occupied it was unacceptable.
4) The last thing, this restaurant location shady. There are adult clubs so won't suggest to go with kids

Typically, I vary tip based on service but they didn't give me option and added the 18% tip by default to bill. bummer for me
author: Sandy K.

description: The eggplant with garlic was good. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The ambiance was quiet as well, but might not be the case at busy hours.
author: Madushanka S.

description: Fried noodles are the best. Love this restaurant. My must visit when I'm in SF. The service is great and all my family enjoys it
author: Berenice G.

description: Had a nice visit after a poetry reading at the Beat Museum across the street. The staff treated us perfectly, the many plates of indescribable food superb. Our host was so impressed, he left a 50% tip!
author: Carl M.

description: We had to have chinese food before we left San Francisco and we are glad we found this place.  A short walk from the waterfront and another short walk through Chinatown to Union Square.  The Braised Crispy Chicken (J2) is probably the best Chinese Dish we have ever had.  Perfect spice level and very nice presentation.  Fried rice was also very good.
author: Teampcbeach ..

description: Very good, but not amazing Chinese food. Ordered delivery, so can't comment on the location itself.
author: Charlie L.

description: Yes even though Little Szechuan is not in Chinatown it sure belongs there. It's only a block away. We were a family of 24 on a holiday weekend Sunday afternoon and these guys specially Bobby served as good as anyone can. The food was fresh extremely delicious and authentic and if you like spicy this is the place.
author: Misak N.

description: We were visiting SF on vacation and went fairly late on a Tuesday.  We couldn't have enjoyed our experience here more.  The service was incredibly fast and friendly.  Nikki, who works there, was so sweet and helpful.  Most importantly, the food was amazing.  I've had my fair share of Chinese food in the past, and this was some of the best.  It's also reasonably priced and right around the corner from a fun blues bar.  I will definitely go back for more Honey Walnut Chicken next time I'm in SF!
author: Nate C.

description: way too salty. i ordered the mapo tofu, sizzling soup, and chicken fried rice. i should have read these reviews before ordering.
author: Adrienne M.

description: Food is just okay. Not too bad but I've definitely had better. Out waitress wasn't too happy when we didn't order alcoholic beverages. Stir fry string beans were a bit bland. Pork spare ribs had too much fat.
author: Mai K.

description: Really great experience. They squeezed us in on Christmas Eve, and the service was prompt, food came out quickly, and everyone was very friendly. The food was very good, with just the right kick. Will be back to try other items on the menu.
author: Dan V.

description:
My favorite thing about Little Szechuan is the variety of dishes that they have. It's a great place to bring a group of people, not only because the restaurant itself is large and spacious, but because as long as everyone is wanting Eastern flavors, they're sure to find something palatable. 

The place is, as I said, spacious and done up in highly lacquered reds and blacks. It's definitely more upscale than other Chinese restaurants, although I still usually get takeout because the lack of windows and color palette makes the restaurant too dark for me. It almost feels more like a bar and less like a restaurant. 

The wait staff is decent. They are very good about taking your order and bringing food, although they could be a bit more attentive about filling up water glasses, especially since their spicy dishes are rather spicy.

The food itself is overall quite tasty, nicely prepared and heavy on the spices. The portions are really great, as is the pricing. It's definitely on the low end of "$$". I would suggest ordering their more unusual or regional dishes, as their generic Americanized ones taste about the same as any Chinese take-out place. The presentation is prettier and the rice is fluffier, but basically it's the exact same flavors and cooking techniques.

I've had the Tan tan noodles, which was delicious but so full of anise that my tongue was numb halfway through the meal. Their sesame chicken was nicely prepared and had a good crunch. My go-to is definitely the spicy beef noodle soup. It's so warming and hearty and oh so filling. The only big negative about the food at Little Szechuan is that some dishes randomly do not come with any vegetables. My sesame chicken lunch special was a large scoop of rice and a large scoop of the chicken. I think there was an orange slice garnish, but that made for an unbalanced-feeling meal.

Oh! And the lunch special is very worthwhile, although offered on weekdays. Noticeably cheaper, just as filling, and it comes with a little cup of hot + sour soup. The end.
author: Jasper P.

description: Honestly after all the Chinese food we ate this weekend... I don't understand why this place isn't busier and rated higher?! The food here was amazing! The servers and employees were so attentive and nice. Very rare for a non American chain Asian restaurant. We stopped by here because our kids were starving after walking around embarcadero for super bowl 50 events. Everywhere we wanted to try had a huge line. We came in a bit worried because it was empty but I immediately ordered a shrimp fried rice for the crying kids and they understood and rushed it. Then we ordered the garlic chicken wings and oh man that dish was ridiculously good! Deep fried pieces of garlic everywhere! We wanted to order a second plate! The seafood and vegetable dish was really good. The tofu and seafood soup was perfectly seasoned to perfection and just hits the spot since it was so cold outside. Definitely we will be back here when we're in the area!
author: Linh T.

description:
Ordered dinner thru Eat24 for co-workers who were staying late and everything was great.  A few of our guys 'don't like Chinese takeout' and everyone was happy with their food.  Fast delivery and not too greasy.  Egg Rolls were marginal, but Pot Stickers, Crab Rangoons were good apps.
Mongolian Lamb and Szechuan Beef were also quality.  One thing to keep in mind is that not all the entrees come with Rice.  Be sure to clarify.
author: Owen N.

description: Ordered delivery, came fast. Green onion pancake was alright, but was kind of hard and super greasy. Vegetable chow mein was kind of really gross, super greasy, and on the tasteless side. Took one bite of kung pao prawns and instantly regretted it. Tasted extremely fishy and the texture was super off. Fully expect to get sick, to be honest. Had to throw everything out. Will not be making this mistake again.
author: Carly W.

description:
Hi Bobby,
your good old friends from Germany were back again. We enjoyed a perfect evening with you and again your cuisine was extraordinary. My friend said: This was the best Chinese cuisine outside of China and he knows what he is talking about as he has to go there every month. So please keep going on as you are and our next stay in San Francisco, that we hope will come soon again will lead us back to you. For sure !!!
All the best Maja & Oliver
author: Maja M.

description: Our party of 5 enjoyed our experience at Little Szechuan very much. As some members of the party don't tolerate spice well, we ordered our peppery dishes "mild" which meant the flavour was not as authentic as it might have been, due to no fault of the chef. The mapo tofu, the eggplant in garlic sauce, and the honey walnut shrimp were very good, the sizzling black pepper beef good, and the dumplings with chives bland. The service was extremely fast, polite and friendly, the manager made a point of visiting politely. A bucket of 5 beers for $15 was a great deal and the price of the entire meal was very reasonable.
author: Ann S.

description: Thoroughly enjoyed a meal there tonight with three others. Particularly liked the duck and curry dish. Based on the photo outside our waiter was Bobby, to whom I would like to give particular praise as he was enthusiastic, friendly, knowledgeable and just really the epitome of how a waitperson should be. Admittedly, this is not a food destination by any means but if you are looking for good food in a nice atmosphere definitely give this place a try.
author: D. Scott C.

description: Very good spicy seafood and eggplant dishes. Spicy fish tasty. Taro and mango smoothies yum. Friendly servers. A.
author: Jingo Django J.

description: Nothing special. I enjoyed the moo shoo pork but everything else we ordered was pretty ordinary. Not what you would hope for in Chinatown.
author: Manny C.

description: We had lunch here, I had the honey shrimp and walnuts..BEST CHINESE FOOD EVER! My wife had the vegetables and rice and my green tea was WONDERFUL!
author: JOSEPH A.

description: Delivery- no plum sauce for mushoo, no sweet and sour for egg rolls. Fried rice way over soy sauced.
author: Krista I.

description: Good food, not amazing but good. We had the sizzling rice soup, salt and pepper wings and potstickers.
author: Susan S.

description:
I've been coming to SFO for years, and Chinatown has always been a stop during my stays. Somehow, I have missed this gem, amongst the string of dives I have been to before. It starts when you enter, you actually feel safe eating there. Second, the staff greets you as you enter and makes you feel welcome throughout your stay.
And the food...I began with the Spicy Dumplings, which were fine. But, the F9  Shredded Pork with Garlic Sauce was outstanding, with plenty of fire to satisfy my need for SPICE. Along with a few beers, my evening was complete. I'll definitely be back!
author: Kent T.

description: I found myself stranded in San Francisco today (Over 1000 miles from home), and stopped here for a bite to eat. Bobby was one of the kindest most helpful people I met here. The food was tasty as well! Bobby, of you're reading this, thank you, and you forever have my business when I inevitably return to the bay area.
author: Alexandra M.

description: We eat here (or order  delivery) about once or twice per week. The food is great and has a unique authentic flair.
author: Achille B.

description:
Flavorful, consistent, and well- packaged delivery.  I'm a HUGE fan, ordering at least once a week.  Vegetarian chow mien, vegetable pot stickers,  onion cake, and garlic eggplant is a symphony of savory goodness!  I wish I had found LS earlier!  

Not giving 5 stars as I'm hoping for more vegetarian options.
author: Lishdish R.

description: After a long walk stumbled into this red joint. Ordered crispy chilli chicken, cold noodles and pea sprouts. Best food ever. Perfect spiciness and great service.
author: Sudeep B.

description: Second time here and we where just as impressed as the first.    Fast and fresh. With great service.   The owner checked on us both visits and brought over a special house sauce that was great.  Ty for a great experience
author: Chris And April S.

description: It wasn't bad, but I wasn't like wow or severely satisfied.  It was really salty, I wasn't sure why!  Overall, I will try another dish another day to give it another chance.
author: Raja D.

description: I ordered the flaming fish fillet in oil through Uber eats. One of my favorite dishes. It was mediocre, and moreover, didn't come with rice, which if you are familiar with the dish, is essential. Seriously, how are you supposed to eat this dish without rice? As well, it had bean sprouts instead of cabbage. Which I understand as an aesthetic consideration for American customers, but it was bland--the bean sprouts really don't soak up any of the flavor the way the cabbage does. Hopefully they serve his dish with rice in the restaurant, only reason this review gets two stars instead of one.
author: Carter C.

description: Good food, great customer service. Our waitress was completely on top of everything and was warm and seemed happy to be at our service. Bobby, who I assume is the owner, was very personable and genuine. He had the cook make a special order Szechuan style Kung Pao chicken for me, my girlfriend had the Szechuan cold noodle. Both dishes were good but the cold noodle was excellent. Oh and the honey-lemon green tea was bomb. They even gave us hella fortune cookies. All around great dining experience we will definitely be back. Thanks Bobby
author: Saht H.

description: Tried this place last night and everyone enjoyed it. Big portions. Delivery was very fast (less than 30 minutes) and you can order online/pay by credit card. We got the eggrolls, crab rangoon, orange chicken, vegetable chow mein, vegetable moo shu and kung pow prawns.  Don't forget to order a side of rice if you want it because it does not come with entrees!
author: Sally S.

description: Ordered food for delivery at 12pm, it's now almost 2pm and nothing yet. Too bad because I was looking forward to trying it out.
author: George H.

description: Food was amazingly good. There's a lot of Chinese restaurants in the area but this is definitely the one you want to hit up. It's been open for about 6 months. Not only is the service great and everyone friendly, but the food is the best!!!
author: Jack L.

description: I came here with my parents. This is a great restaurant provided with typical Szechuan food, as we all come from Chengdu, Szechuan：） Enjoy a nice meal
author: Wenlan T.

description:
I've lived in SF my whole life and this new spot is now my go-to Chinese. The dishes are both authentic and creative, the presentation puts other Chinese spots to shame, and the incredible flavors their kitchen develops are a real treat. I've met the owner and the manager (who is maybe the owner's son?) and they are super nice and have a real passion for the business. They always accommodate us when we come with a group to eat and watch games on their TVs (great spot to get really good food, a bunch of beers and watch Giants/Niners/Warriors games without spending a ton of $$$.) Everything on the menu is really good, from the traditional chow mein (more flavor than any I've had elsewhere) to the dumpling (amazing!) to the creative dishes like their really spicy soups (sizzling rice, boiled beef, lots of others.)

Take my word and go, you will have the best Chinese dinner in a long long time.
author: Tom A.

description: Great Szechuan taste! They serve it as spicy as I want. You will not be disappointed!!!
author: Mei W.

description: The food is good, but the services was simply terrible today.  Bad enough to make me rethink returning for awhile.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
If you're coming here in hopes of genuine, delicious, tongue numbing Sichuan food, I'd look elsewhere.

We got my regular "let's see what kind of Sichuan food this place serves":
- cold noodles - bleh. No flavor. I can't believe they got this wrong -- even the most mediocre Sichuan restaurants in the bay can get this right
- chongqing la zi ji - this is the dry fried chicken cooked in a lot of chili peppers and sichuan peppercorn. Their version was not spicy, slightly bitter/off tasting, felt really greasy, and just... blech. My friends complained that it just didn't have much chicken, though the chicken:pepper ratio seemed alright to me.
- "beef cooked in water" - I forget what they call this in the English translation, but in Chinese this is "shui zhu niu rou". This was also not very spicy, and the dish itself felt smaller than what I was expecting. I'm also used to a version that has napa at the bottom, and this did not, which was kind of a disappointment 

We also got:
- scallion pancakes - this was probably the best dish of the meal, no joke. It also came out last, well after we had dug into all our other dishes, despite having ordered everything at the same time.
- sauteed mustard greens - this was probably the second best dish of the meal. I'm glad they did not screw up sautéing veggies in garlic. 
- a pickled cabbage appetizer - my friend remarked that it was much sweeter than what he was expecting. I have no baseline for this, so take it with a grain of salt.
- rice - same old, same old.

If you're looking for regular old American-y Chinese food, this place might be alright. The dishes that looked like sesame/orange chicken looked normal when I saw them on other people's tables. However, if you're a hunter of delicious Sichuan food, I'd go elsewhere. (Little Sichuan in Newark is one of my favorites in the bay, and is highly worth the drive from SF.)
author: Chris M.

description: Eh...it's edible but definitely not worth the expense since there are better options.
author: Max S.

description: New restaurant in the area and so so good! Very big inside, clean and modern. The menu is huge! Get a sizzling platter, it's a show at your table and its really delicious. I ate all vegetarian and everything was tasty, but there's so much more to try. Everyone who works here is really nice, just all around great place.
author: Marisa L.

description: Came in for a late school night dinner. Really good beef kimchi fried rice on a sizzling platter. Staff were super friendly and offered to up the spice level for us. Cumin lamb was also v good.
author: Arnab B.

description: My girlfriend and I came to this place, craving sichuan like none other. Unfortunately, we were sorely unimpressed by this place. One of the dishes we ordered was boiled beef in chili oil. After a few bites in, we noticed that there was a fly in it! The kicker was that the manager told us that a bug flew inside while we were eating. I think not! We would have noticed if a fly went into our soup. Albeit, the manager finally gave us a replacement after some convincing...I was a little worried that there were additional "ingredients" in the replacement. Aside from the beef dish, we also ordered the spicy fried chicken (can't remember the exact name). Each piece of chicken had a chunk of pure salt on it. If I wanted to taste the ocean, I would have went to the beach instead. I would have given this place one star if the manager didn't give us a replacement dish. There are way better sichuan restaurants in the bay area, particularly in the east. Go to the one in Albany which is a Michelin recommended!! I will never recommend this place to anyone.
author: Chris K.

description: After having this place pointed out to me & reading Yelp reviews, we came here last night.  I love the nice yet simple atmosphere with great service & reasonable prices.  They serve some of the best Szechwan & Cantonese cuisine in the area; so, weather you are in the mood for something spicy & something mild or one or the other, there is something for everyone.  The pot stickers are crispy golden wiwith a well seasoned ground pork, ginger, & cabbage filling; perfect with a little soy sauce over the top.  The spicy wontons are perfect with a thin wrapper & a wonderful ground pork filling with a tongue tingling sinus cleaning chili sauce.  The green onion pancake is thin, crispy, & greqasless with the perfect dough to onion ratio; perfect with the dipping sauce that comes with it.  The black pepper sizzling beef platter is wonderful with tender marinaded beef, fresh zuchini, onions, & peppers in a wonderful black pepper sauce; my cousins were wowed about how he brought out the sizzling platter & then scooped everything onto itl; needles to say, watching it sizzle & the wonderful smell caught there attension.  The tan tan noodles are aldentae with well seasoned ground pork & onions in a spicy amoky peanut sauce that packs a one two punch.  The prawns with honey walnuts were wonderful with suculent prawns, a lite badder, & just the write amount of mayonaisse with crispy honey walnuts.  My mother & cousins enjoyed the chicken egg foo young & chicken fried rice as those are not my favorite things to get.  Round it off with a couple Tsing Taos & you will not be disappointed.  Our waiter fchecked in with us to see how everything was periodically & we loved the 70's funk they had going on Iheart Radio.  So, for excellent Szechwan & Cantonese cuisine with friendly service in a nice yet casual atmosphere, Little Sichuan cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys..
author: Brian S.

description: Honestly the food was pretty good but Sichuan home and Z and Y are just better.  We ordered the classic cold chicken and pork dishes and they had the exact same flavor, while the two are supposed to be similar they aren't supposed to taste exactly the same.  I believe we also ordered the spicy boiling fish which was satisfactory.
author: Charles W.

description: Delicious!!! Veggie steamed dumplings (Huge), cucumber salad (enough for 2) and then he had mu shu mixed veggies and I had prawn fried rice! Wow, lots of food and wonderful.
author: Carrie H.

description: Worst service and longest wait of my life. From the time we ordered to the time we got our food, we waited two hours. While waiting, we saw at least seven people complain to whoever they could grab and pay attention to them. In retrospect, yes, we should have put some cash down for the drinks we actually received and walked out. However, after waiting ten minutes, fifteen minutes, thirty, forty and so on we figured our food would shortly arrive, like the waiters we talked to told us. Ultimately, we received our food and we were absolutely starving at that point. Even then, the food was mediocre at best. My friend actually didn't take her leftovers home with us, and she had almost an entire plate of salt and pepper chicken wings left.
author: Justine E.

description: Perfect Szechuan food with a spicy take on traditonal dishes. The potstickers are well done. The dan-dan mian is excellent, and has a no traditonal dose of sichuan pepper. The chicken with chili is hilarious - you get mounds of chili pods. Can't wait for my order to arrive tonight.
author: L E.

description: The best part of the restaurant was the service and thats it. The food was the worst szechuan food ive had at an "authentic "  resturant. My szechuan wife and I agree and even returned one dish and are only part of the other. We then paid, and headed to another restaurant.
author: M M.

description:
Double check before paying the check, because they charged us extra which they changed after reminding them.
The service is not the best, but the food is good.
author: Gee B.

description: Horrible.  Plain horrible.  I ordered at 6:07pm and the delivery came at 7:38.  I called the restaurant, but not even apology.  Never order from this place ever again.
author: Crash T.

description: Pricey little joint for deliveries, minimum of $30. Anyhow, the portions are odd, some of which was covered with dry chillies and other herbs with very little lamb or the cold dish pork and garlic sauce was filled to the bream. Not sure the measurements are very consistent. I was looking for a great Szechuan place for awhile now and so far this is as good as it gets.
author: Ann Hui Y.

description: I may be a little biased because I grew up eating at Robert and Stevens Chinese restaurants. Stumbled in here recently and found out this is there newest spot. Ordered a few dishes and .... Wow. Some of the best Chinese food I have ever had. Anyone who knows me knows Chinese food is my favorite and I'm pretty picky. All I can say is I know why I love Chinese food so much. I grew up with Stevens and Roberts restaurants. Chefs that are from china. Come by and try it out. Top five Chinese restaurants I have been in!
author: eric t.

description: Great food. Not too packed. I love all their spicy dishes.
author: Kirushanth S.

description: The ma po tofu, Sichuan beef, and salt and pepper prawns were okay but not really prepared in an authentic style. Portions were  slightly on the small side too, but at least the prices were reasonably low and the service was nice and fast.
author: Thomson Y.

description:
My wife and I took our friend here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We had eaten here a few times before and enjoyed the food. Service has always been just so-so. Their spicy beef keeps getting smaller and smaller. This time, such a small portion. Do these people think we are crazy and won't notice the difference? We ordered the MaboDofu. It was not so good and later suffered from it. The green beans were not fresh and served luke warm. Just because the photos look good does not mean the food is fresh and delicious. 
We have experience with restaurants in China reusing the oil from hot pot and spicy dishes. This last meal left us all questioning if that was the case because the oil tasted a little different.
Unfortunately, we won't go back. We are still searching for an good authentic Szechuan restaurant in SF. Especially one that provides good service along with good food at a reasonable price.
author: V J.

description: Good, quality Szechuan food right around the corner! Fantastic quality chicken...something I'm super picky about. The kung pao is nice and spicy and the chili oil here is great. I'm always on the lookout for good egg flower soul, and this place has it! The portions are good for the price and I've never had to wait linger than 15 minutes to pick up my order.
author: A S.

description: Dan Dan noodles and cucumber salad are good. Szechuan chicken was a bit disappointing; the chilly peppers seemed to be cooked separately from the chicken so the flavors were not mingled at all. Service was a bit slow; rice did not come with an entree.
author: Lee M.

description: The egg rolls of the best  the generals chicken even better service is Good.  Dining room is big perfect place to host a big group dinner kitchen is clean.... I eat here about twice a week, I would recommend it to anybody on broadway or in the City for that matter.
author: Shaun B.

description: Loved this place so much, we came back two times during our 1 week vacation. Between the 2 visits, we tried the broccoli beef, the general tso's chicken, the kung pao chicken, and the braised string beans. We were amazed that after both meals, we did not feel that usual heavy feeling you get after eating most Chinese food. The food was very tasty. I was particularly surprised at the general tso's chicken which was very crispy. It was easy to walk in and get a table. There were TV's along the wall playing football, which was a nice touch. The music was a fun mix of pop music, new and old. The staff in the restaurant was so friendly to us and went out of their way to see how we liked the food. I think I have high Chinese Food standards as a New Yorker, and Litlte Szechuan exceeded them in every way
author: Danielle D.

description: Sort of hit or miss depending on what you order.  Beware some of the stuff is a bit unusual to the Western palette.
author: C U.

description: Came here with my friends when we were visiting sf and we didn't like the service. They took along time to bring out the food and they never checked up on us for more water or whatever else. The place was pretty much empty so it's not like they were very busy to not be able to check on us. The food was alright but we found it overpriced.
author: Laura D.

description: The food is so bad, tastes not good! They're very expensive! A small fish costs me 50 dollars and it's not the traditional. Quantity is too little, we are very disappointed! Never come back again!
author: Li C.

description: This is the first time I ordered Chinese food that I liked. It tasted really fresh vs.something that was sitting around. I don't love Chinese and I really liked this. We ordered the mu-shu chicken, chowmein, eggplant, beef and broccoli and wonton soup. I'd highly recommend it all.
author: Heather R.

description: Not as good as expected. Not tasty nor fresh. Their chef don't know how to cook real Sichuan dishes
author: Lin L.

description: This place is amazing. Have been here twice in 2 days.  Mongolian lamb and Szechuan beef are incredible. Great variety, definitely recommend it to everyone.
author: Cheryl B.

description: Great service and very relaxed atmosphere. We ordered "boring" dishes like Kung Pao Chicken and Mongolian Beef, but they were still fantastic. They add the perfect amount of spice in spicy dishes, and we'd recommend.
author: Kevin H.

description: We were looking for a Chinese style breakfast and decided to give Little Szechuan a try. Super good. Had green onion pancakes, pork chive dumpling an amazing vegetable egg foo young. Nice decor, friendly service and very clean - something I like to see in a restaurant. Don't let the limited number of reviews deter you    - the place only opened last week!  Will definitely return on our next visit to SF and explore the menu further.
author: Eric M.

description: Not a Z&Y but good Szechuan. Favorites are the braised string beans, fish in flaming oil and their free hot n sour soup. We've always been pleasantly surprised with their sweet n sour pork since it's got a good balance of sweet and sour (not too sweet like most places) but yesterday's batch was a little disappointing because there were more pineapple chunks than pork pieces. Sad since its been one of our go-to dishes. Overall, its good especually for the area its in.
author: Melinda V.

description: Food is decent, ordered delivery. They forgot utensils and napkins but they came back.
author: Kevin R.

description: Good selection of Chinese food, especially if you like spicy. The marinated pork and the spicy dumplings were my favourite of our meal.
author: Brendan V.

description: Perfect match of quality & value. Fresh, properly seasoned ingredients make this a real stand-out.
author: Mike B.

description: Hands down the best chinese (Szechuan) restaurant in the Bay Area. I brought some relatives over from China and they were all impressed how authentic the food tasted. We ordered the whole catfish (huge), spicy chicken (my favorite), dry pepper pork chop, beef roll and spicy wontons. All of them were great.  The home made hot chili oil is to die for.  I used up half the bottle of hot chili myself. Bobby, our server, was also awesome. He recommended some of the dishes and I'm glad he did.  There was a huge banquet area downstairs and was told by Bobby that they host large events like weddings and company parties down there.  I will definitely be back to Little Szechuan for the amazing food and great service!
author: kevin T.

description: I highly recommend the cold noodles, spicy chicken and hot oil beef. This is probably one of if not the cleanest sichuan restaurants I have been to. The atmosphere is very nice and in a great location. The place is huge too. Great for groups.
author: Justin Y.

description: I ordered food for delivery from there the other night. It was probably one of the best szechuan places in San Francisco. I had the braised crispy chicken and twice cooked pork with combo fried rice. Both had alot of flavor and good amount of spice, i would definately recomend these two dishes. I was told that it would be delivered in about an hour but it arrived early which was good because i was starving. I will be ordering from them again soon and cant wait to try more its from there large menu.
author: Cloris Z.

description: Good food!  i personally enjoyed the pot stickers, hot and sour soup, broccoli beef (i dont eat beef) but the broccoli and sauce were good!  etc.   Some waitress were very friendly and attentive.  Lunch special is a good deal with soup, and a lot of items to choose from.   short wait.  comfortable environment.  restroom is beautiful..
author: D F.

description: I ordered delivery to my hotel. Which was a great service after an exhausting day. However the food was the worst quality ever and very disappointing!!!!! The crab rangoons were hollow !! There was nothing but air inside. I'm not sure what they are thinking selling that to the public. The kung pow prawns were runny with mostly green peppers and onions. It had maybe 7 shrimp in it total. Definitely not worth 16.00 dollars. The same problem with the seafood pan fried noodles . Very , very little seafood and a lot of broccoli and it came as soup to pour over crispy noodles . Big mess!! It was a wasted $40.00. Make the effort to go out somewhere . This place should not be in business!!!!!!
author: Penelope B.

description: Super tasty. I asked for really spicy szechuan beef and beans. The food I got was extraordinary and the service was first class!
author: Piotr O.

description: Wow... Just wow!!!!  The first good Asian food we've had in 6 years!  To top it off Bobby was incredibly nice and gave great suggestions!   We will definitely be coming back with family and friends next time!  Worth the stop I promise!
author: Amie G.

description: This is a brand new chinese restaurant of Sichuan style.The food taste excellent ,  graceful environment , nice and neat , very reasonable price! I ordered beef pancake which was perfect ! Must try! I have to keep coming back to discover more excellent food!
author: Aaron W.

description: Brand new restaurant as of early 2014. My neighbor Amy, Chinese American, referred me to it. My husband and I had lunch here on a weekday. I had their chicken salad. The strips of crispy chicken were delicious. There was a little too much wasabi in the dressing though. My husband had a beef broccoli dish that he liked a great deal. I sampled it and agreed, but we didn't share our dishes as planned because he couldn't tolerate the wasabi. We'd also ordered potstickers but those never came. Wait staff is brand new plus the fact that the young server didn't have the best grasp of English. We're sure to go back. Until they get it JUST right. They're not far off the mark.
author: Paula H.

description: We have been craving for spicy food. We read the reviews on Yelp and went to Little Sichuan for dinner on a Sunday evening. We had dumplings with spicy sauce, Chongkin spicy chicken, Chongkin whole fish, and sautéed vegetable. The food was satisfying and the service was nice. The reason why I gave it one star is because both my husband and I got sick the next day.
author: Julia H.

description:
TASTY is the word that comes to mind when I recall my last meal here. Every item we had was well seasoned and authentically prepared. The menu offers an extensive variety of classic Szechuan dishes. We ordered a total of 4 dishes between the three of us, and it was plenty of food. If you've never tried Szechuan food before, your mouth is in for a taste and sensory adventure!

I'm a pretty adventurous eater and wanted to try something new in spite of my dining companions' dubious expressions. We started the meal with two of the cold plates-  Bean Jello in Red Chili Sauce, and Spicy Beef Tendon. The chili sauce in the bean jello dish was delicious! Spicy, garlicky, salty,  in just the right balance. The bean jello was an interesting textural vehicle for the spicy sauce. My dining buddies polished it off with delight and surprise. The Spicy Beef Tendon was also delish, although the texture was more to my liking than to my friends. Gelatinous beef tendon sliced paper thin and seasoned with a pleasantly pungent dressing of chili oil. It has a fun, chewy, rubbery texture, but I'd understand if this isn't to everyone's textural preference. Next to come out was the House Combo Fried Rice, which had that yummy, slightly smoky, fried rice flavor only a super hot, commercial wok can achieve. Finally, we ended the meal with Spicy Beef Noodle Soup, which was also excellent. I don't know how it's made, but there were huge slices of tender beef brisket with possibly hand-pulled noodles floating in a hearty, gravy-like broth with a subtle vinegar kick to it. If you're in the mood for Szechuan comfort food, you are in for a treat at Little Szechuan. Service was fast and the restaurant is open till 10 on weeknights!
author: Katherine J.

description: Food was ok definitely not the best Chinese food you can get in Chinatown. The service was terrible, waitress was very rude and the appetizer came after the main dish, we ask her to cancel and she said no, when we were done eating it was when the appetizer came, would not come back here.
author: Linny M.

description: I've been exploring Szechuan restaurants in the city for the last year and Little Szechuan is the most recent addition to my list. Z&Y was my go to for a long time but I think Little Szechuan may have them beat! Really great food, friendly service, and no wait. Bobby even told us the best way to cook with our leftovers. Really impressed, will be back.
author: Sean L.

description: Pretty good place if you are craving for spicy food and don't want to deal with the long wait at Z&Y. We came here with a big group and so we got a chance to try quite a few different dishes. I really like the Salt & Pepper Fisk Fillet and Hot Braised Whole Fish! well done!!
author: Yve H.

description: Every dish we ordered was good.  We had pea sprout w/garlic, eggplant w/garlic sauce, mandarin spareribs, cucumber salad, and Szechuan style chicken.  I ordered a tapioca milk tea to go, that was just ok to me.  It taste like Quickly's.  The staff was very nice.  I'm very happy to find this restaurant and will definitely go back soon!
author: Hosick F.

description: The fish (cod) in chili oil dish is excellent and so are the green beans. Highly recommend for an authentic Szechuan meal.
author: A G.

description: Ordered delivery. Food came cold, hot & sour soup, Kung Pao Shrimp, and burnt but cold dumplings. No flavor other than hot peppers and sriracha sprinkled on top. Driver was rude, wish I hadn't pre-tipped. Not worth it. 7-Eleven pizza would have been better.
author: Maria R.

description: Food is not authentic at all. It's more Cantonese than Szechuan.  Environment and service is good.
author: Dion D.

description: Service is awesome, food is very authentic. Make sure you try the hot pot whole fish, best Szechuan style fish in town! Other dishes are great too.
author: Aaron D.

description: So my husband and I were craving authentic Chinese Mandarin food. This place was def a number one choice! I came on Yelp to review top places and this place trumped all the places in China Town. Being bon and raised in Flushing Queens NY I am very picky and expect good food at a god price. My husband ordered Kung Pao, I got a spicy beef with broccoli, and our kids got the Mongolian beef and sesame chicken. Oh my! The food was tender and delicious!!!!!! The owner was also very kind . I had a 15% off coupon from yelp and he was thankful we tried his food. U need to try this place!
author: Nadia H.

description: Love it! Z&Y is usually my go to place but it has become so crowded and there is always a wait no matter what time of the day it is. I was delighted to find out this new place right by china town and was even happier after I tried their dishes. Solid authentic spicy food! So far I have tried and liked: the Szechuan baked whole fish, beef in chili oil, Szechuan chili chicken, garlic A vegetable...yum yum yum!! The decor is beautiful too. I hope more people will give this place a try so it will remain in business. Ps it delivers too. Can't wait to go back!
author: Qiqi W.

description: This place is severely under-rated, This is probably one of the best sichuan restaurants I've ever been to, and the fact that the prices are actually cheap for the lunch special makes this place a wonderful. I always get Q24, the twice cooked pork. It is soooo delicious!!!
author: Davis W.

description: Was in town for business staying in the financial district. Found this place.. Great service from Bobby... He recommended three dishes, Kung pao shrimp, crispy chicken and egg plant..  Great choices, great service..  Will come back when I'm back in the city
author: J S.

description: Good food, big portions, fast service. Recommended! Ate mostly vegetarian dishes. Had veggie dumplings, veggie pot stickers, veggie fried rice, veggie mu shu, and sesame chicken.
author: Rae Ann D.

description: Food is decent, (which is why I wouldn't give a 1 star review.) however the food itself is very over priced. Delivery driver woman was very persistent for a cash tip even though I tipped through the app. Super rude. Came knocking on my door after I signed for the food and closed my door. I had explained I tipped through the app.
author: T D.

description: There is no actual Szechuan peppers in this "Szechuan" food. If you are familiar with that lovely numbing flavor of the Szechuan pepper that is unique to Szechuan food you won't find it here. Otherwise a serviceable Chinese food place.
author: Nader E.

description: As many locals know, it can be hard to find consistently good, well prepared Chinese food in Chinatown. Was pleasantly surprised by this place, though. Nice spacious atmosphere, clean, friendly welcoming staff. Aside from their Szechuan specialties the menu lists a lot of the standard Chinese dishes, but many seem to have a little Szechuan twist to them, which is a good thing. Large portions. Tasty spicy peanuts on the tables for munching. The hot and sour soup was really good, tofu with veg was excellent. Very reasonable prices. Good feeling inside this place. I wish I was there again right now. Will definitely return!
author: David K.

description: Awesome food,great place, Kung pow chicken amazing, also the braised greenbeans are the best I've ever had, prices were very reasonable too! Our new place for Chinese food!
author: Christine S.

description: We visited on a Sunday evening with a group of 8, which was perfect for the circular family table. Every plate from meats to veggies was a delicious blend of flavors, mostly salty and spicy. But more importantly, the staff was extremely nice and service was great!
author: Hope G.

description: Best Chinese in San Fran hands down. Great staff, bobby was awesome. Don't be fooled because this place isn't in China town. It's in its own category. Pork fried rice / black pepper beef / honey walnut shrimp / and spicy chicken wings. Can't name everything we tried. But couldn't get enough of it
author: J S.

description: I had high expectations after reading the reviews.  Perhaps it is what we ordered or because we ordered for delivery, but we were very disappointed with the food.  Not very high quality meat, sauces too sweet . . . just not what we had hoped it would be.
author: Jaimi Z.

description: All food was very enjoyable. Staff was kind and welcoming. Place was clean. Good spot
author: Leif A.

description: got general tso's and food poisoning for lunch on Monday, bedridden for 36 hours. awful.
author: David K.

description:
We ate here with 3 of us and ordered dishes suggested to us by Bobby, the manager at Little Szechuan.  Great recommendations and extremely hospitable service by all.

We started with Pork w/ Vegetable Dumplings, hot and sour soup (spicy but tasty!). We had Satay Chicken in Sizzling Platter in a hot clay pot and asked for garlic to be added to the sauce: Sweet but spicy- a knockout!.  In addition, the Beef Chow Fun Noodle, Braised String Bean Veggie dish,Szechuan Beef and Vegetable Fried Rice were all flavorful and very fresh.  

Prices are excellent.  Don't miss this tasty deal.

Peter from Boston
author: Peter R.

description: Good food!  Great service!  We are here on vacation and randomly chose this place.  My colleagues and I had a great time.  Beers are reasonably priced and food is very good!
author: Rodger S.

description: I've always order online for delivery. They're the fastest food delivery in town! I've tried other places, they take between 45 mins to more than 60 mins. for food arrival. Thumbs up! :)
author: Leanne P.

description: Had the Shrimp Fried rice, Lemon chicken, and Spicy Egg plant.....All 3 were awesome!  Totally would come back and definitely recommend it!!!
author: Jason Z.

description: Most authentic Szechuan in San Francisco. Good vegetarian options as well.
author: Jerry B.

description: This place was dope! Food was so good and our waiter, bobby, was so nice and accommodating. The food came out in a weird order but the meal was very delicious and enjoyable.
author: Amalia B.

description: Me and my bf came for late lunch. I had the Peking duck with a side of white rice, he had honk kong style fried rice, and we got the Beijing dumpling appetizer. Absolutiste delicious! All of it! I wish I could order more!
author: Lety M.

description: Great food! Bobby was great, service staff was very helpful and attentive. Will definitely be recommending and coming back! Wonton soup and braised string beans are da bomb!!! :)
author: Brittany W.

description: Delicious!!! I can't believe I didn't know about this restaurant until just now. Great food, friendly staffs, nice place.
author: Esther L.

description: Only been to this place once. We ordered a couple dishes. The Peking duck was really impressed. I can say it is the best pecking duck I have so far in Bay Area. And they have my favorite yogurt drink "Beijing yogurt". Yum yum!! Will go back soon to try more dishes out.
author: AM X.

description: We stumbled upon this place when visiting SF from London. What a hidden gem it is! Great food was matched with fast, friendly service. Would recommend to anyone looking for some nice, fresh Chinese food.
author: Ali H.

description: The restaurant was a bit dark and humid. The food was okay, but I think some items were overpriced.
author: Michelle T.

description: friendly staff and very clean restaurant. szechuan beef and the braised wings were super good.
author: Jisha A.

description: Was looking for tasty authentic Chinese food, and this place sure hit the spot.  Restaurant itself is very nice, great Chinese decor and roomy floor plan.  Service was attentive.  Most important, food was delicious!  Definitely would come back
author: Daniel D.

description: We was here a couple weeks ago .we got like 6different things among the 4 of us.everything was delicious.good enough the vegetarians.             Overall: excellent food, excellent service.
author: Leon S.

description: by far my favorite Chinese place in SF! the food is outstanding and thier customer service is top notch. they have really great delivery turn over times too! and if you call and need to make a change to anything they are happy to accommodate! for example tonight i ordered through Eat24 however to my own fault i submitted my order as pick up. when i realized what i had done i called the restaurant and asked to switch to delivery they happily and easily made the change. they also have the friendliest delivery guys!  my favorites are the spicy braised string beans, mu shu pork, prawns fried rice and beef chow fun and my fiance loves the general taos chicken! i have nothing but good things to say about this restaurant!
author: Meagan M.

description: For a few months since its opening, this was one of the best Szechuan restaurants in SF. That changed when they got a new chef. Although the menu looks the same, just about every dish is made differently in a bad way. Everything tastes sweet now.
author: keith s.

description: so far, the worst restaurant I have eaten in S.F. the sichuan-style pork is actually cheap fatty bacon...service is good but...well...
author: Shuting Z.

description: I felt sick after eating here. Food had a very strange after taste. Stomach hurts today. I should have stayed away...
author: Pavel P.

description: I've been using yelp for a while but I have only written one review in the past.  This place was worthy of the second review.  I came here to get a quick bite to eat.  I've heard that the chinese food in SF is usually sub-par because it caters to american tastes.  When I saw various versions of steamed intestine on the menu I knew this place wasn't trying to pretend to be something its not.  I'm a vegetarian so I didn't try the intestine but the fact that it was on the menu gave the place some authenticity points.  There were a good amount of vegetarian options, I had the braised tofu which was pretty great.  They also make a house hot sauce which was the right balance of tangy, spicy, sweet and sour.  Everyone in our group enjoyed the food.   The owner came by our table to check on how things were going, a really great guy, super friendly.  He said they just opened up a few months ago, that said there are plenty of solid reviews already.  I have found my go to chinese spot in SF.
author: Anish A.

description: Great service great food and clean bathrooms! love it! This place is a little out of the way but I know where the good food is! I will be back!
author: Steven S.

description: For being in China Town I would think the food would be quality. The to go boxes aren't even filled. The Kung Pao was sour as if it went bad. No flavor, the shrimp fried rice had diced shrimp in it. Not worth the trip.
author: arti n.

description: New to the area for a trip and wanted old school chinese food in Chinatown. Read lots of reviews and walked by this place and decided to try it. It's right outside Chinatown. We tried crab rangoons, dumplings, chicken lettuce wraps, chow mien, and kung pao chicken. Ended up eating there 3 days in a row! We loved it. The chive and pork dumplings were awesome, yummy and fresh kung pao, great chicken lettuce wraps with peanuts and cilantro, and the spicy chicken was great with a pretty presentation of tons of hot chiles! Can't wait to go back to SF to eat here again. People were friendly and helpful, especially by our third night in a row.
author: Jeanna B.

description: Love their beef roll and honey beef w/ egg tofu. Foods and services are great!
author: Calvin H.

description: Best Chinese during  my 4 days of stay in San Fran.  Their dishes are faithful to their origins but do not require re-engineering of American taste buds.  We ordered the garlic fish in chili oil, cumin lamb and chicken wings. The wine we had was full bodied and smooth and pared well with the food. Surprised to see a Chinese restaurant at this price range having a good selection of wine and beer.   The staff was very helpful and pleasant.  One of my favorite restaurants in the city.
author: Hong N.

description: I love this place! Their roast fish is so good! Along with other amazing dishes. Service is very good too.
author: Danlu H.

description: You have to try this great place if in SF! Excellent food and excellent service. We are from southern California and would love to have a place like this near us. The food was amazing. We were in SF for a short vacation and luckily found this place. Next time we are in SF we will be back!!
author: Paul L.

description: I go here a lot to bring in tour groups. They treat us well, of course, but the quality of the food is amazing. I haven't had a tourist yet leave with the feeling that they didn't just have an excellent meal. Some of these people even traveled and ate in multiple asian countries, so they know quality, authentic food. Go here and enjoy. The atmosphere is great and the food is better!
author: Andrew W.

description: I had the spicy dry rub pork ribs. They were good. The atmosphere was better than expected, it was a nice place I could see you taking someone important. It was well decorated with Chinese things. The food was good, a little pricey but good.
author: Jay Y.

description: Service was great, food pretty awesome and prices very reasonable! They went out of their way to make sure my food was free of mushrooms which I'm allergic to. I would definitely eat here again when I come back to town.
author: Alex G.

description: Absolutely fantastic food, very fast delivery, and very reasonable prices. Absolutely love this place.
author: Joshua T.

description: We absolutely loved this place.  We arrived early (about 15 minutes) for our 5 o clock reservation.  We just arrived from the East Coast and were very hungry for dinner.  We were greeted by a very friendly hostess and who we presume was the owner/manager.  We were told that in addition to the items on the menu, they could make anything we wanted.  The food was so delicious, and fresh tasting.  We ordered pretty standard fare, moo shu chicken, mixed vegetable fried rice and a sizzling salmon dish from the Specialties menu.  The food was absolutely delicious and we'd go back in heartbeat.  The whole experience was delightful.
author: Nick D.

description: Disappointing.  Both the spicy wontons and cold noodles tasted flat (wontons were too sweet and the noodles were heavy on the salt).  Both could've used more huajiao.  There's no excuse for noodles being soft, bordering on mushy.  I'm giving up on finding decent Sichuan food in San Francisco.
author: Debra L.

description: Picked it because it looked super clean in Chinatown area. Not authentic chinese. But very good. Large portions. And it was super clean ! I would recommend it if you are craving north Americanized Chinese food.
author: Myles M.

description: I ordered directly through Yelp, but didn't receive a confirmation right away.  I called a couple of times to ask questions and Bobby answered the phone each time.  He was so polite and courteous; he put me at ease about my order and offered to start the order right away even though it hadn't come through with Eat24 yet.  He called back to confirm items when he said he would; his customer service was awesome!  They delivered quickly to our staff meeting and all of my staff agreed that the food was great (my desk clerks want a menu for ordering at work!).  We had the Chicken Fried Rice, Chicken Chow Mien, Orange Chicken, Sweet and Sour Pork and the Mixed Veggies were the absolute bomb!! The only reason I didn't give them a 5 star review was because I was told the order would be good enough for 9 people; it actually was only enough for 7 (2 didn't show to the meeting; if they had, we would've had even smaller amounts).  I definitely will order from them again!
author: Sheena C.
